review: Noelle's Yelp Notebook 2017 My husband, son and I dined here a few weeks ago. We came on a weekday and it wasn't busy at all. Customer service was friendly and accommodating from start to finish. We ordered the following: Pretzel Bites appetizer (3.5/5) Kids cheese pizza (4/5) Red's Tavern Double Burger (3.5/5) Crispy Chicken Salad (4/5) Kids milkshake (4/5) One soda One iced tea  Slice of Mud Pie (4/5) The pretzels bites weren't bad but the cheese that accompanied it was a tad on the salty side. The kids Pizza was freshly made and my son seemed to like enjoy it. My husband ordered the burger and said it was okay. I had the crispy chicken salad which was delish but there was at least a cups worth of wilted pieces- just as a side note this is very large. The slice of mud pie was super large and delish but too big for two people, we didn't finish it at all. This is a decent spot to eat at when heading to the Gilroy Outlets. I don't recommend waiting if there is a line out the door- because the food is just okay. Our bill was $50.20 before tip, so after it was said and done our bill was closer to $60. Noelle's Notes Overpriced and just okay tasting food

I feel bad giving it such a low rating since the service, the hostess and waitress were so nice and accommodating but the food is TERRIBLE. Later after eating here, me my husband and son got sick. The food also looks bad and presentation is lazy. The burgers look and taste everything but gourmet.  We've visited many other locations and always loved it so we ended up very disappointed after our visit here.

The avo-Cobb-o salad. Do not get it. Horrible. No AVO. Ok. 2 very thin slivers and NO BLUE CHEESE CRUMBLES. Slightly warm chicken.  Not to sure I will return here. The last couple times have been just simply a waste of money.  You would be Better off going elsewhere.  Our server, Joanna was pleasant and very tentative.

My wife and I finished a long day riding dirt bikes and wanted a delicious burger. She ordered a chicken sandwich that she enjoyed and I got a "Smokey bacon cheddar" something burger.. sounds delish right? The lettuce was half turned and the burger was dry as could be. Their bartender was good but spread way too thin. I could tell by the heat off my plate it was sitting in the window for a long time. They took a long time to reach the table. All and all, I'm skipping this place from now on. They are consistent. Consistently bad.

Food is usually pretty good, can't go wrong with any of their burgers. However, I've come a handful of times where the service is REALLY SLOW. Not because it is busy but for some odd reason. For this very reason, I usually opt to go to chilis to not be disappointed.
Wow, this place is really awful. From the disgusting burnt food to the crappy service. Go to Chillies or in and out, trust me, this place is bad.

I decided to come here bc I was too lazy to cook and I had a 21% off to go orders coupon. I arrived a few minutes early so I went inside to wait. The eye candy bartender was a major treat. I think I would come in just to watch him like one would repeatedly return to a store to stare longingly at a Hermès bag that they want but can't have. The food was nicely packaged and ready even before the estimated time.  I ordered the smoky tavern burger and upgraded to poutine fries. I went home and started with the fries. I enjoyed the saltiness of the cheese curds with the garlic aioli and gravy. The flavors blended so well together. I don't think I can eat their fries any other way now. I'm not sure I'd order the cheese curds alone because smaller pieces were more breading that cheese. They were very filling. 5 stars The burger just didn't deliver like the sriacha double tavern I had a couple weeks ago. The BBQ sauce was delicious but needed more. The pepper jack cheese though I love didn't really do it for me. There was no heat. No savory taste. I think corporate needs to go back to the drawing board with this one. At least there was ranch in the bag that I could dip the burger in to enhance the taste. 3 stars

Yet another swing and a miss. Previously we have gone here and I've had poor service, but this time was an epic fail.  I ordered a burger with "sauce on the side, no pickles, tomatoes or raw onions, but I still want the onion strings on it." At any other restaurant, this is a normal request. However, my burger came without any sauce, produce of any kind, and none of the onion strings or other things that should have been on it. Picture a plain patty of meat with a slice of cheese melted on top.  I requested the onion strings and sauces, but only got onion strings.  I'm tired of going to this place and having my order messed up. I eat on a very controlled diet, and very rarely want a burger, but when I do, I want a great burger. Next time, I will not go there. :(  (This isn't the first time!)  I'm giving 2 stars because they actually brought us fries a couple of times... which doesn't always happen.

Really wish I had read the reviews before I came here! I came because my friend who lives in another city says that Red Robin has the best fish and chips. And they might have been okay if they weren't cold. The Long Island iced tea, on the other hand, was the worst! All it tasted like was a lemonade. The owners of this place need to figure out what their employees are doing wrong.

Super good vegan options! Garden burger sub the dijon mustard for guacamole is the best! It's nice to have a restaurant that I can eat at with my family who don't have dietary restrictions. This restaurant has always been really accommodating and friendly.
These stars are for my server Katie, thank you so much for your friendly and warm energy. The food was yummy and i would definitely come back for the wonderful service.
Service was good.  I like the at table checkout. Burger was good but the Poutine was cold.

DO NOT EAT HERE IF YOU HAVE FOOD ALLERGIES. Went to a Red Robin in another town after finding it on the Find Me Gluten Free app. Celiacs runs in my family, and I get extremely ill when exposed to gluten. After going to the one in San Bruno, I knew the deal and knew what to do... I thought.   As a chain, I had increased trust becaude they have a higher legal stake from being largescale. I have been to Red Robin before in another city very recently so I knew how the process this time. First I asked the hostess for the gluten free menu. The hostess instead argued with me that they don't have one. When I mentioned the previous Red Robin, she argued more and tried handing me the nutritional menu (which only shows calories). I told her to ask her manager about the gluten free menu, and she STILL argued about it until I demanded that she ask for it. Lo and behold, the gluten free menu does exist. Anyways, the waitress was very outgoing but wouldn't stop talking about my gluten problem. She kept mentioning not ever hearing about it until the last few years (my aunt was diagnosed over 30 years ago, but okay, sure. It's brand new). She basically made me her teacher, and while I was willing to explain, it was altogether uncomfortable. Anyways, she wrote Celiac on the ticket and took my order. The food took a while to come out and when it did I started eating it. About half way through something seemed off. I opened it up, and sure enough there were breaded fried jalapenos in there. I'm not the kind of person to demand a manager or demand a refund, but I expect the waitress to take it seriously after the restaurant POISONS a customer with an allergen. This is a legal issue. No manager came by, and no discount was given for the meal. The waitress LITERALLY said "Just BELIEVE that you won't get sick!" As I write this, the migraine and stomach problems are already creeping in. I feel awful and I will be feeling awful for at least a couple days. I don't get to BELIEVE I won't get sick. It is my biology. I'm lucky to only have a gluten problem. If I had an anaphylaxis inducing allergy to something I would be in the hospital tonight instead of just having to call in to work and school. I will not be eating at any Red Robin again.

Just plain horrible service. You'll be lucky to get a second serving of "bottomless" fries within 20 minutes of actually finishing your whole meal. I honestly feel like the management here intentionally does this so that you get less food and the get more profit. I won't ever return here.

Really bad service! The endless fries are not endless because they never bring them! We are not coming back. We had to ask for drink refills when all our glasses were empty. The burgers were about like fast food level. Waitress avoided eye contact at all times. So sad!

I have been a Red Robin fanatic for years. Went to the Morgan Hill location while in town for a tournament. Wait was normal for a Saturday.  The host (Anthony) seated us, and I requested if they could put on the local Fox station, because there was a UFC event on that afternoon. Anthony did, and all was good...ordered our drinks and apps.  2 out of 3 drinks are brought, (ran out of the draft I ordered) no big deal, I ordered something else. We order our main, and went to town on our onion rings. Server never asked how we'd like our burgers cooked, so I pray and hope it comes out ok. Finish our o-rings, and our burgers arrive about 10 minutes later. Burger is cooked all the way through, yet the cheese hasn't melted onto the meat. As if they cooked off 100 patties earlier, and just nuked them later. Burger is cold, cheese is goeey, and the fries are cold and almost soggy.  Server was nowhere to be seen for about 15 minutes...so I didn't have a chance to bring it to her attention. Halfway into our burgers, Anthony comes over with the remote, and changes the channel. With 3 other TV's, I asked him why he changed the channel. His response was "my manager told me it's a corporate policy, not to broadcast it" Being a bit annoyed, and dissatisfied, we left in a hurry. I forgot my Oakley sunglasses, and my Patriots hat I wore. So the following morning, we stopped by on our way out of town to collect those items. Girl at the hostess stand, tells us that the items are nowhere to be found. My guess is, the busser grabbed the Oakleys, and tossed the hat. A few days later, I reached out to Red Robin Corp, and asked if there was a policy against showing boxing, or MMA - apparently there isn't one. The manager just had her panties in a bunch, and deemed it inappropriate for adults of age to watch. I've been to at least a dozen different RR's, and luckily I live FAR away from Morgan Hill. So chances are slim, that I'll ever visit again.

Not sure why this place rates so poorly. The hostess was not friendly at all which is strange, when you consider that she's the first person someone encounters after walking in... The burger was excellent, and the server guy was very good.

Went with a party of 13. I was told wait would be 10-15 min.  40 MIN LATER.. with an almost empty restaurant, FINALLY got seated. Appreciated that we were given fries while we waited for food since it  took forever, and half the food was cold. We were not once offered refills on soft drinks. 2.5 hours later which is way to long if you ask me.. We were out of there. I actually had to get up and ask for check since tablet was not working.  I will prob not be back any time soon.

Had Togo order of clucks and shrimp.  Quantity is very small. $15 for 2 chicken strips, 4 shrimps & 2 lettuce leaves is way too much!!! I did not receive coleslaw. Waiter said quantity of coleslaw is small and don't worry about the missing item!  I hope headquarters make a note of this. Why would I come next day to receive missing coleslaw?
Love this location  Big space, fast seating fast service food gets to your table while it's hot. Only thing is that the salted caramel shake is ruined... was so good and I don't know what happened.

1.  Had to go find the hostess to seat us. 2.  Six empty tables that hadn't been bussed when we arrived (9-10 by the time we left)... 3.  Took 30 minutes for our food to come out, and it was cold so we had to send it back. 4.  Took 10 minutes for it to come back and my sweet potato fries were still cold. 5.  Bottomless fries didn't come out till we spoke to the manager.  He was very nice.  The female day manager ignored the mess, wiped the floor once and spent 20 minutes in the bathroom. 6.  Just leaving now after sitting here for almost 2 hour's, and the old food on the table next to us is sitting there still.  The milkshakes left there have already separated!

Waaaaaaayyy better people and service than the one by our house(ghetto eastridge).  I mean, for being just a red Robin joint in a outdoor strip mall, I was definitely impressed here. Friendly host greeted promptly upon entering. We were seated within 5min. Serving staff happily waited on us for drink orders in just under 5min ...all smiles and politeness. We had our 3yr old and the server easily accomidated sooner than later bites for our son to snack on while waiting. our food came accordingly but timely  what was awesome was the constant check in on us and drink refill ...u don't get that at all in some places. Overall, definitely one of the better Red Robin joints I been to and will definitely do it again.

This restaurant continues to decline..... had to go find our own napkins and silverware...cold, soggy and scant French fries. No offer of soda refills. No offer of bottomless fry refill. We've eaten here for years and the service has gotten worse each year. We won't be back.

Nine of us went in last night for an early dinner. The food was very good and so was the service. The waiter recommended the "Mad Love Burger". It was new but we wanted to try something new. It was delicious and spot on. We had a large party and not only was the waiter great so was the entire staff. The waiter has a great sense of humor which always helps when you have 2 toddlers. We were all impressed.

This place is so disappointing.  They no longer have my favorite burger.  The fish and chips that used to be Amazing, now look like they come frozen and prebreaded and so much smaller.  I would never order fish and chips again.  Their fries are still good and my bruschetta chicken sandwich was great.  Still contemplating if I'll ever go back.  Probably not, too many other good restaurants in town.  The service on our last visit was just mediocre.  The best service I've had in my past visits were in the bar area.  Bartenders are great servers! If you want good fish and chips, go to The City Fish at Monterey and Tennant.  I haven't had a bad meal yet.

I came today to celebrate my girlfriends  birthday becuse we love there food but today at this location I did not like the service given to us today. The waiter took very long to take our order followed by a suposibly manager on training we didn't even know who came up to us asking if we were okay.she was not wearing a uniform or looked formal at all she brought our food to us with half of her finger in our plates. Drinks were refilled only when we asked  Will not be here at this location for a while. I can say it was the worst birthday dinner for my girlfriend.
Sticky Menus and sticky tables. We waited around for about 30 minutes at our table and STILL didn't get service. Also, my burger looked like cat vomit.

From the moment we had a warm welcome from the host and then next we see our old buddy Fred! Immediately we requested to seat with him. We had let him know this was our first time eating here and suggested items and drinks that are good. Very pleasant dining experience and we even got tickets to a local community baseball game. Thank you Fred !!!

It seems lack of management is a problem. Came in tonight about 6:30. Almost all the tables needed clearing and stayed like that throughout our visit.  We wanted wings. All out.  Ordered two drinks. Did not come. After about 15 minutes, had to go to the bar and ask. Ordered dinner. Delivered salad for one dinner and burger for the other. Very skimpy fries with the burger. Salad not tossed so dressing in a puddle in the middle. When dinners delivered no silverware. Asked. Took 5 min to arrive and when it did waiter had glasses of water in his hands and silverware under his arm pit. No kidding in his armpit. We are actually pretty easy going but really. The people involved seem very nice but inexperienced and not trained. Not a great evening. Red Robin do not come down on wait staff. It is management.

First visit in several years. Just remembered why I hadn't comeback. Ordered their $1.99 burger they charge $6.99 for, and I'm being generous when I say that, and oh yes, the bottomless fries that I saw the bottom of from my one and only serving.. Guess I could have stood up on my chair and sang 'do you remember me'?  I tried making eye contact without making a scene, but even getting the bill was in doubt so I went up to the bar where my waitress was washing dishes, put 10 bucks down and left.. The fries I didn't need, so maybe that's a good thing. But the offer is an age old gimmick....thats how they get you, order your second helping at the time they drop off your first order!  Chow! Or lack of

Tables were all in need of bussing. We were handed menus at the door then told to go find a seat. I came back complaining about the dirty tables and then was seated on the other side of the restaurant. We waited roughly 10 minutes for a server. We were only ordering deserts, so we figured it wouldn't take long. I ordered the freckled lemonade cake and my wife got the mudslide. My wife's was brought out about 10 minutes later, but not mine. The server came back to let us know they don't have lemonade cake anymore and the menus are all old. I'm not sure how that happens or why she wouldn't know this when putting in orders, but I had to wait another 5 minutes for my food.  We aren't coming back anymore. This place is always disorganized and the food is subpar at best.

So, this is my updated review. The servers are generally always friendly and prompt, and the food is pretty good. The issue with the kitchen appears to have been fixed. There is still a wait for food, but definitely not as long as before.

Called in meal for 3 last night. Was told 15-20 minutes for pick up. I went to pick up meals and they were freshly made, well packaged and ready on time. Had a pleasant experience with ordering, pick up and meal prep. Returned home and had a great meal with the family. Thank you Red Robin for being convenient.

Worst place.. We ordered bottomlless fries, never saw them. When we asked the waitress about them she told with lots of attitude that we're supposed to ask her for a refill. How we were supposed to do that I don't know because she never came by to check if we needed anything. I guess we were supposed to chase her around the restaurant. I ordered the best burger but when she plopped it on the table it was falling apart so bad I had to eat with a knife and fork... When we needed a beer the waitress was too busy flirting with the bar tender she never even glanced over at the table to check on us. Instead she aviod my needs and gave nothing but massive attitude when we asked her about refills. Not going back.

Going in service was fast of course it was late night about 9pm. The service was ok, burgers for my family were made to order and enjoyable. Had to order more fries for myself and daughter because they forgot to bring out her mac n cheese with appetizer and brought it with dinner instead. My plate had about 10 fries, so ordered more which took time. Other than that it was enjoyable.

So we drove about 45 minutes to come here and the food was disappointing. My daughters food was hard and when addressed with the server he made her a new plate by that time it was too late she was disgusted .  Said to say that after I filled out the survey I was approached from a manager. But even though with that it's just sad to know meals aren't being prepared well for children

I have always enjoyed the service and food while sitting at the bar during happy hour but this Saturday night felt like a disorganized grand opening. Hectic. It was just me and my two oldest girls (7/5) and they were looking forward to the table game tablet. It had a bunch of problems and it worked for about 5 minutes prior to food showing up and then they tried to charge $2 for table entertainment. Always heard they have endless fries but my burger came with a small handful and never saw the waitress again until I needed the check. For a $15 burger I didn't get full like other places where I get a take home box. Maybe it was a bad night.

This is our 2nd visit in a month and we cannot understand the negative reviews for this location. Both times, we have been sat quickly, and have had fantastic servers. Personable, knowledgeable and have a sense of urgency.  Food here is inexpensive and tasty - it's not fine dining. But for a burger joint, they have a ton to choose from and it's hard to get bored with such a huge menu.  Bottomless fries have always been offered until we were stuffed to the gills. I never thought I would turn down sweet potato fries, but there are only so many a girl can eat at a time.  Bottom line - we love this location for a family-friendly restaurant!
Service is horrible Manager looks like she just left a bar drunk  Food was cold and everyone played the blame game. Brutal

Just left this POS location after the lazy bartender accused us of leaving without paying when we clearly left 13 dollars cash on the bar. We paid with credit card and we going to leave but when my boyfriend went back in the cash she said we didn't leave was on the back counter in clear view. He asked for his money back they gave him attitude. The manager was even there, gave him the money back and told him to get out like he did something wrong. What kind of people do they have running this place that steal from customers, give them attitude and taunt them. Go here if you want to be ripped off and insulted.

I will not be returning to this red robin.  Our server brought our drinks, took our order and took over 30 minutes for our food! She only had two tables by the way. She brought our burgers and ran away as fast as she could. I wanted ranch and my husband needed a refill. Never checked back on us at all!!!!! Everyone seemed to be just chatting up.  I heard one of the persons in the back "I'm trying to be outta her by 11pm! On the dot" so not profess.  Anyway 1 star for the balloons they have in the front my son loved them.  Oh and the burger was seriously nothing special! Two slices of skinny ass bacon lol. My bread was falling apart. With 4 fries. 50$.

What the hell is an entertainment fee! I came here to give this place redemption i will never ever give red robin the time of day ever again. Our table was dirty service was horrible people who were seated after us got served first. Never once were we asked how things were going. Asked for stuff that was never brought to our table. And this entertainment fee is for the ziosk at the table  and ours wasnt even working because it didnt have a battery yet we were still charged. I hate this place never again!

Ordered a turkey burger, and expected just a normal tasting turkey burger. However, I didn't notice the chipotle sauce on the menu and the burger was simply too spicy for my mouth. Not sure why they can't warn you that an item is spicy, they certainly do it on all Asian restaurants. I told the waiter and he just said "sorry". I was fine with that but when we went to pay the bill he had overcharged us by $10. Sure, it was a mistake but he certainly didn't deserve a tip. Other restaurants would probably say more than just sorry.

This is by far the worst red Robin I've been too. For a Friday night they were The service was slow and unorganized. And it dominoed to cold food and worst service.   We were seated fairly promptly.  The waiter was busy and average at getting to us. We ordered and waited.  Other tables that came in after us got their food before us.  Eventually our waiter came and asked how we were.  And I said "hungry!".  Then the food arrived.  The server said our order was listed for another table and that table was empty.  Since the food was late it was Lukewarm to cold.   We asked the waiter for several things, chocolate milk (came late), "bottomless" fries, only came with the food, and requests for more never made it. napkins (never came) warm cheese for pretzels ( took 10 minutes).  We paid and asked for a box( Never came).   It's unbelievable that a franchise like this is so sub-standard.  I won't be coming back to this red Robin.
If I could give zero stars I would. We got our meal to go and it has to be the worse meal ever. The bread was soggy on our sandwiches, Mac n cheese looked like it was scrapped off someone's plate.

LOUD!!! OMG. The tv's were so loud people had to raise their voices to talk over them. My burger was average at best. For $13 it and the fries were small. Fries were cold and I counted only 8. I had to ask for another order. Bar Server was nice and efficient, however. This was my first Red Robbin experience. I will NEVER visit one of their establishments again in the future.

Noted on experience here at red robin;  Waited for water (10 min)  Waiting for our server ( Never showed/ had the host take our order and be the server) Appetizers cheese sticks ( 5 min)  Food ( decent and took 10 min)  Service : good; but I would recommend somewhere the bill isn't high for no server and attitude. I get its 45 min before closing but you're still open guys.

Most disorganized Red Robin I have ever been in. Inadequate staff for the business volume. Young and poorly trained waitstaff. Long wait for service after seating, ran out of eating utensils, and did not come until after food was delivered. Empty tables were unbussed.  However food was good.

Went here last night.  Food was average... my daughter liked the mac n cheese but only because she likes the way the box Mac N Cheese tastes... it tastes just like it.  The service was awful.  A lot of waiting.
Just returned to MGH. This place has gone down hill since we have been gone. $5 Dollars for a half a cup of guacamole and salsa! WTH. Also slow, bad service.

This spot is always hit or miss. Either they're busy AF or they're dead and the servers are all just chatting waiting for you to GTFO The quality of the food is kinda going downhill too. Spotty. Sometimes there's a weird flavor to the burgers that you just can't put your finger on.... I think twice is enough to give a place a chance.  #ByeFelicia

This RR has the worst customer service from any RR that I've ever been to. Even when it's not busy we end up waiting for someone to acknowledge us. I've given them quite a few chances because I don't want to drive all the way to San Jose but from now on I'll be driving to the SJ location. The burgers are also a little dry at this location.

Looks like they remodeled since the last time I was here.  I miss all the memorabilia that was on the walls.  Looks too plain and naked now. The new cash out terminal is a plus.  Service was good, drink order taken immediately.   Our food was very good, served st a good temperature.   Overall  I still like this place.

My family and were visiting Morgan hill and decided to go eat at Red Robin , despite the fact that we had a bad experience at a Red Robin in Manteca . We understand the wait is long , no biggie , 1/2 hour not bad . We were seated and our orders were taken promptly , the wait for our food was horrible !! We waited 45 minutes to finally get our food , which was all cold when it arrived . Never again will we be going to a Red Robin !

So the kids and I got hungry and decided to have Red Robin for dinner. This was probably one of the best services we've ever had at the Red Robin in Morgan Hill. Our server Ashley did a phenomenal job keeping the drinks filled, the sauces coming and made sure we had everything we need checking up on us every time she passed by. Not more than 5 minutes passed before checking in to see if we needed anything always with a smile. That makes the food so much better. Great job to her managers on to Red Robin in Morgan Hill keep it up.

This place has gotten a lot better. My wife and I have been coming here a lot more often. The food is good and the service has been a lot more attentive. The overall look has also improved with the added walls that also help to cut down the noise.

Ok I can go on about how much the service SUCKS. But let me "spark notes" this for you. -- Manager on duty was rude and lazy. Servers were busting their behinds while she sat and watched.  Fly in my water cup and didn't get an other one until my sister went behind the bar to get me a new one  Servers were busing tables, but not the whole table just the cups because apparently they didn't have enough.  Oh and the food was cold when received.  That is all.

Oh Red Robin, once again you stole my cholesterol-filled tumor of what I call "a heart" and awarded me with such an awesome free birthday burger that I couldn't resist. Again, I don't throw 5 stars around loosely so this is saying a lot :) I haven't been here since my high school years but it felt good coming back since I usually go to the RR at Eastridge whenever I'm in SJ so coming here again was nice for a change. The atmosphere was chill and it wasn't a full house mid-day. We were seated right away but orders did take a while. Our server was super nice and gave me lots of bottomless fries and my bottomless strawberry limeade arrived quickly. I ordered the Banzai burger & ate the whole thing! It was delicious! So sweet and savory with every bite and the meat was super juicy along with the pineapple slices that topped everything off. I wish I could have more of that yummy Banzai burger...definitely one of my top favs items from RR. Anyways everything was on point and this place did not disappoint. I had a great service coming here so keep up the good work.

I would like to tell my story about this particular Red Robin. I have always been a huge fan of Red Robin. I love their food and mostly their friendly staff. We were visiting some family in Morgan Hill and we decided to grab a late lunch/early dinner. We arrived at Red Robin and greeted by the host immediately. We were seated in less than 5 minutes. Shortly after being seated our original waitress addressed us stating that she was told to go home because she was on overtime. Meanwhile, we still weren't asked what we wanted to drink. Our new server was introduced and again failed to take our drink order until we asked her. She ended up taking our kids order so they didn't get impatient . However, the service went to crap from there. We were sitting for another 10 minutes or so before we finally told her we are ready to order and she rolled our eyes. At this point our order was placed and we were patiently waiting for our food. While waiting for our food another waitress was sticking her hand down her pants scratching her bum. We were all disgusted with this behavior. Thankfully, she was not our waitress. Our waitress arrived with our food shortly after the previous incident. While 3/4 of our party received their food the other 2 did not and she apologized and had the kitchen get the orders out asap. This is were it got interesting. My sibling and his wife received cold chicken sandwiches as well as mayonnaise which they didn't ask for (not a big deal). Well, I bit into my sandwich and I bit into a big long blond hair. I literally almost threw up on the table. We immediately asked for the manager and we had to ask 4 different waiters before she came over. She asked what the problem was and I aggressively told her that I had a hair in my food. She told me to calm down and not be aggressive. I asked her what she would do if she bit into a piece of hair? Guess what? Crickets!!!! We told her that we just wanted to leave and she became irritated and started rolling her eyes telling us just to leave. This behavior is not tolerable at all and she didn't try to rectify the issue at hand. I believe the way she managed the situation was her poor and she should not be working with the public. I have to say, I am not the one to complain; however, this was not acceptable nor will I ever be back to a Red Robin again. I will spend my money elsewhere. I will be writing a letter to the corporate office to tell my story. Thank you for reading my review.

Ever since first visit everything has gone down hill.   Not a single F is given every time I come here. I love RR food but the entire staff except a handful are completely indifferent.   Not sure if they're understaffed or there's terrible management.  Maybe both.   If you want RR go to a San Jose location.

Incompetent staff, with a negative attitude. I usually don't write reviews because I'm too lazy but this staff/branch needs to be completely overhauled. The manager appeared to be confused in all tasks, the kitchen was slow (turnaround times). I'll gladly drive an extra 20 minutes to another red robin. Avoid this location at all costs

Venue is very nice. Great place to take family and or friends. The burgers aren't very big and the meat is ok but have had better. The garlic frys are amazing but the onion rings are the best out of any place.

Just finishing up here. Came in , sat right away, greeted nicely, drink order right away. My waitress was well versed in the Menu. Asked my taste preference and was right on for both of us! The place was clean throughout. We sat in the bar. I personally Love that it's for over 21 and they adhere to that!!! You get 5 stars for that! We had the smoke and pepper burger. Perfect size , Great flavor and the bun was light! So each bite was well balanced. Tea was fresh. And the deep fried pickles were well coated, thin and not greasy like other places! Love that they are chips and not spears! I'll be back so I hope you have great consistency !! Thank You!

All three times I have been there burgers have been great marking  it down one star due to the fact our waitress asked every single person if they had a rewards card but didn't ask me I had to tell her I had it if not I would of missed out on the 15% deal going on

Well, we used to love to go for burgers, but the service has really taken a dive. We just tried to call in an order for takeout to avoid the long waits in there. The first call was answered, and after pressing 1 for take out, we were transferred to the front, then asked again for take out. Put on hold...and waited almost 10 mins on hold. Hung up and called back, informed the person who answered that we were left on hold, and she apologized. Guess what, we were put back on hold, and nobody ever answered. Wow. They need some training over there!

Terrible service. Ordered my burger pink and it came to me burned. Took 50 minutes to get our order as well. Inattentive forgetful server.  Ordered a premium dipping sauce that was less than a tablespoon portion. STAY AWAY~!!! I am so disappointed.

Was craving a burger and decided not to go for the usual In-N-Out (can't go wrong). Gourmet Burgers and Bottomless fries sounds appealing... Red Robin, here we go! Getting seated was fairly quick; however, everything that followed was slow and executed poorly. Took 20 minutes before our waitress (name removed) got our orders. It took another 20 minutes for the food to come out. My friend and I each ordered the Bleu Ribbon burger (which was cold by the time it arrived) and ate some of it and noticed it didn't taste right. We waved down our waitress and explained that our burgers were missing its signature ingredient--Bleu cheese! She stared at the burgers and shook her head in disapproval. Instead of saying something along the lines of "I'm sorry", she appeared to be annoyed as she said, "hold up, I'll get you some Bleu cheese. What the hell? My friend took action into his own hands and grabbed both of our plates to another waitress for two newly made Bleu Ribbon burgers.  Oh, and the "bottomless fries"? I got gray hair just waiting for a refill to replenish your eaten fries. Technically, it is "bottomless" so long as you have the superhuman patience to wait for their service. Oh, and the sweet potato fries we ordered were slightly burnt!  Our waitress definitely provided the crappiest service and seems like she does not want to work there... What a terrible $50 meal (for four people). Sorry, no tip for you, nor am I ever returning. Should have just stuck with In-N-Out...

What a mistake. Slow and incompetent service, cold food and overall something I badly want to forget. Even the portions were a joke. Yes, you get all the fries you want, but they give you ten then make you wait 20-minutes for more. I wish I had read the other help reviews before throwing away my hard earned monies.
Horrible service awful food will not be returning! Tried giving this place a chance but just end up frustrated and disappointed!!

Awesome service, delicious food. I loved the shroom burger. Fries are good too. It was pretty empty at the time that i came.. (Lunch time) people complaining about things like they aren't human. They served us quick, they served us warm food. Coming to a burger joint to eat eggs?--eh.. 2+2=banana apparently to some people.  I'd come back to this location.. But I don't live in San Joose.. Peace and food.
Five star for for this location. The lady that helped us is such a sweet heart. We are definitely coming back here. Great food, wonderful lady server.

Just had the best service ever from our server Lori. We were a group of 11 and She was super fast! So friendly! & simply amazing! She refilled our fries and drinks as soon as she saw we were almost done with them.  We weren't done eating and they were closing and she didn't rush us at all. I really loved her service, she was so full of energy and definitely makes us want to go back to this Red Robin.

Came here at lunch time. They seem to be short staffed. There we a lot of dirty tables and floors and it smelled in here. There was no bus boy so the host was half way cleaning tables. Moving dirty glasses and plates piling them on one table. Our food was sitting on the cooks table for 10 minutes before we got it. Waitress was nice. Okay service and okay food just DIRTY! Won't be coming back anytime soon. All the other reviews your reading are true. Mangers need to step up and clean this place up.

I used to love coming here often, now I barely even come. They used to have really good cooks who followed orders the first time, and really big food plates, especially the salads. Now its remodeled, higher prices, Cheaper food, less portions, and zoosks on the tables. I pay extra for a cheap a** salad that used to be a big plate. And i forgot to mention, my salad was like 80% lettuce, my black beans portion was probably a tablespoon size. Thats not food, that's an appetizer. Im done eating here, today was my last straw. Should have kept it old style and worry less about how your place looks like, and worry more about the quality of your food.

Just had dinner. Very disappointed with the server she slide my knife to me, instead of giving my husband's meal directly to him, she stood beside me and I had to pass it to him and there was plenty of room for her to deliver it too him.  Had to wait for my mother in-laws milk shake, this was suppose to be delivered with the meal.  Every R.R.  I have been too brought the shake to us just before the meal.  Had to ask for sweeter for my ice tea, had to ask for refills of our soda and ice tea.  The refill of fries were so small it barley covered the bottomless basket.  The only bright spot was the manager who gave us our three dollar discount that we got by clicking an an ad on waze maps even though it did not state that we had to be a part of the rewards program.  Guess we will make a point of not stopping here again. Oh yes r server did bring me an extra tarter sauce, thanks for that.
Cant there be 0 star option. No refills, no more froes and waiting an hour for food.never never never again. What a waste of money.

If I could give negative stars I would. My family just left there and we walked away with a free meal because our server was so terrible. (Possible meth problem)  Here are the problems we encountered: Didn't receive drinks after asking twice.  Silverware came dirty and dropped onto the table.  Burgers were not brought out at the same time because one wasn't input into the pos system. The cooks didn't know it was ordered.  Two burgers were ordered without tomatoes and there were tomatoes on both.  The fries weren't hot.  I ordered more sauce, that I was "charged" since it appears on the little game console and then it was forgotten.  Took many attempts to get drink refills.  After much grief I approached the hostess who sent over the manager. The manager served the rest of our food, got us more fries and drink refills and ultimately took care of our entire meal.  This manager said that she coached this server and that she is fairly new, and my family thinks that this server should let customers know she's new to the restaurant. It would inspire more sympathy. The manager was very nice, she didn't have to cover our meal.  Oh and she never told us her name, otherwise I would name drop.  These possible meth problems were pretty bad. Say no to drugs kids.

Called ahead to see if there was a wait. I was told "no" parked my car and went in and was told the wait was 25-30 min. Walked right out and went to chillis. Disappointed.  I really wanted to  try the food here and I had a party 6 with me.

Thank god the servers don't work for nasa... Or else we would have another columbia space shuttle incident... The manager needs to be a ex drill sergeant so they can get some motivation up in here... Because the manager was our server ha!

The event was the worse. Arrived with my wife wearing a tie and she in a dress and heels. Had to wait for one of the five empty booths to be cleaned. The waitress was nice but after she took our order we were ignored. Had to have the person bringing the order to the table to get us silverware. Then no drink refills and even though I ordered bottomless fries, never asked if I wanted more. The waitress was taking care of three booths in a row and we were the middle booth. She took care of the others nicely and kept passing us by. Finally when we asked for the check, she handed it to my wife. I said nothing but put my credit card on top. When she brought it back she handed it to my wife and my wife had to say to give it to me. Mind you, I was in a shirt and tie and never spoke to her except for my order. Dang Shame.   Avoid and eat elsewhere.

Oh man I really hate to do this...but it has to be done. I used to really like coming here but this time might be my last time. We walked in and were immediately guided over to the bar area and told to pick a seat. I guess they weren't seating in the dining room? I opted for a booth. We eventually got to order our drinks and then our burgers. When the burgers and (tiny amount of) fries came out (took a little over 10 min) the french fries were cold...both my sweet potato fries and my husbands steak fries...cold..and my burger was not much warmer...Once our server came by I let him know and he brought over some new fries (a huge basket each) full of boiding lava hot fries. I'm super disappointed in this place...I feel like the quality has gone way downhill and I honestly can't recommend this place to my friends or family...

The food was good. The delay in getting the food was so long it had gone from being a nuisance to being almost funny.  By the time the food got there, it was almost time to change the order from a dinner item to a breakfast choice (well, not quite). The waiter staff was fine, but there is some kind of very serious management problem associated with the kitchen.

I have to honestly say the hostesses here are terrible!!!!!!!!! I don't know if they hire lazy people for that job, but it sure seems like it though. They should tell there greeters to actually greet the customer, and not ignore us, happens everytime! I Might never come back here, each time I think they're going to hire great, friendly welcoming people and yet they don't. Although our waiter was nice and cheerful. If you do go I recommend our server Steven, he seemed like the only one there that liked his job. The positive, my burger was yummy and hot as well as my friends, he refilled my friends drink quickly, asked how we we're doing often, didn't seem to get annoyed at our 21 questions, and never rushed us out of there! :)  I'm only giving it 2 stars because of the staff.

This was the the worst service I've ever had. That being said I've been to places that didn't speak a word of English and had better service. It took the dude a half hour just to come over to our table and take our orders. Then he was walking by and said oh I forgot about your drinks. Then about 10 minutes later the drinks arrived. Then our food was delivered 15 minutes after that by another waitress. The food was another 1 star the brioche bread on a jack in the box burger doesn't make it gourmet. The waiter instead of checking in on us bussed our table then said oh you can pay on this pad thing. The worst Red Robin ever, I won't be going back to this location maybe all Red Robins.

This place has gone down hill fast. Over the last few visits it has become clear that we need to stop going and after tonight, that's just what will happen. We were seated quickly and our order was taken but it then was explained to us that the kitchen was behind on fry orders. Then for some reason we were offered fries while we waited. My daughters food came out fine (pizza) but my fish was cold, soggy and has no flavor at all. My wife's chicken tasted burnt and fries were cold. They have tried to make their menu "fancy" by making their caesar salads a wedge salad. Talk about disgusting.  After getting our food we needed silverware and we were told that the kitchen was backed up on washing dishes so we would have to wait a few minutes.  So disappointed in the food and service. We will not be going back.

Worst RR visit ever, having been in them across the country,  even worked in one when I was 18. Bartender is an idiot.. was sitting at the bar to myself for 10 minutes before anyone came, and there are people here... it's not like there are only 3 servers, I was walked past I can't tell you how many times. The silverware I was given, not wrapped so there is no excuse, was utterly disgusting. Greasy with drops of something sticky all over it. The plate I just ate off also looks like it was never washed, and for god sakes their beer selection sucks ass. I recommend shying from this RR. Leaving disgusted. This is my 2nd review... it's just that bad.

This review is on food alone our cheese sticks were cold and hard, our main course took too long a simple cheeseburger and corn dogs and oranges for kids over an hour, and the desert was the brownie and ice cream dry and hard bread seemed to be microwaved way too long. I will never bother to stop at this location. Our server was great she was nice it's the cooks and cooking that need to step it up. A red robin  customer I know what this food should taste like and these cooks are way off drive a lil farther and go to eastridge red robin in sj or even the one in Saratoga.

Crap food, poor service. Food came out cold, drinks weren't refilled. Server was totally overwhelmed and can't get things right. The server kept blaming the cooks. You have to totally harass them for soda refill or another round of your so called "endless fries." I will not go back. Place was garbage.

I liked the burgers. I wouldn't call them gourmet(as was claimed) but they were delicious nevertheless. Big place so no issues getting seated either.  Having said that, the place wasn't anything remarkable. We had to wait quiet a bit for the check. Probably because it was late in the the night and there was just one guy taking orders. Nevertheless, was a long wait. Besides, the cutlery wasn't too clean. Was a put off right before the food arrived.

I'm not exactly sure where to start with this one. The service was alright, I mean it was busy so that part I understand. But you should make sure your patrons have at least utensils, that's pretty essential if you ask me. Secondly I ordered the culls an shrimp; I've ordered this before at a red robin in Vacaville and it was really good there. Here- not so much. It comes to the table the shrimp looks Unappealing and you can tell by first glance it was cooked in extremely unclean oil. Plus there were only 5 small pieces and two chicken strips; if I remember correctly the one in Vacaville came with more- it was actually worth 12 dollars. This one was not. Not at all.  Now when the manager came over, he didn't  exactly help either. I said I didn't want it several times and yet he insisted to take it off the bill and get me more strips. That wasn't the point. I did not want it. And he did not listen because awhile later he comes back with more strips.  Thankfully though another, (what I believe to be) manager came over. He was much easier to work with and actually listened and got us everything the other manager & waitress did not. Sadly I don't know his name but he was probably the only reason I have two stars. Though! I found it awfully rude that when the second manager was speaking to is for the first time the second manager came over and told him not to bug us even though he was doing a lot more good than the first one ever did.  Overall, I probably won't be returning here, hardly come here to begin with anyways.

It's been a year since my poor experience and my husband insisted we try again because he loves it. Sadly, nothing has changed. Still dirty tables, slow service, my burger was over cooked and my fries were cold. The worst Red Robin I have ever been to.  Also, this is the only Red Robin I have been to that doesn't do call ahead seating.

I've been to this location at least 3x and it never fails.  Always at least a 30 minute wait even if there are empty tables plus an additional 30 minutes to 1 hour to get your food.    Cold fries and burgers...   The same excuse I get is that they are understaffed over and over.   Other locations are good and just this location should be avoided if you have hungry kids.     If you have a few extra hours and don't mind cold food this is the place to be while everyone else will be at the nearby Chilli's.

Got seated quickly. Food sucked.  Disappointed cuz it's usually not bad.  My shroom burger was over cooked even though I asked for it to be cooked medium.  The plate had grease all over it. My wife ordered the fish and chips but the batter was soggy and the fish a little dry.  We waited 20 - 30 minutes for a basket of fries.  Honestly, I'm not one to complain but it's really frustrating to spend a bunch of money and not really enjoy the food or the time spent there.

Att:This is not a review for all red robins just this locations .  Today we went in to the Morgan Hill Red Robins and waited and very long time . The wait was so long customers started to get up and leave bc they had realized they had been skipped for a good hour plus after ordering . When we finally got our food my husband found a good part of his patty that was raw , so raw it was cold to the touch . He didn't realize it at first bc he thought it was a tomato. The manager took it off the menu but he's been vomiting shortly after we left non stop and now we are headed to the ER . Smart move to all who left haha

I don't come here expecting 5 star anything when it comes to a fast food place. I would be happy coming here, knowing that it is a solid 3 stars. Not today and not in the past either. We were pleasantly greeted and seated right away. Server came out, sort of quiet but pleasant as well. We ordered our drinks, and she quickly came back with the kids but ours were still being filled at the bar. Fine. She came back, without the drinks and took our order. After 10+ minutes of taking our drink order, they finally arrive AFTER reminding her that we were still waiting. Beer was coldish, wine was warmish. Husband got a wedge salad which was not fresh. The lettuce appeared to have been cut since morning as the edges were dry. The outer leaves were limp, the other problem was that the dressing was on the outer leaf which was inedible. Husband asked for more dressing and we never got it. We told the server we would not be paying for the salad. She never apologized and just said okay,  We all got our food, the kids were happy with theirs, husband got fish and chips which were what he expected and I got a chicken sandwich and ordered the fruit for the side. All I got was a chicken sandwich in the basket, no fruit, wilted produce and an onion with the skin still on. Peel the onion. Simple. The server noticed that my basket looked missing so she brought me out some fries. 12 of them, they were warmish and I think she took them off of another table who already picked over the good ones. Terrible. None of our food was hot or fresh tasting, it was dying at the window and no one picked it up on time. It was basically one of those meals where you go home hoping that no one gets food poisoning. I will not be coming back. Even if I get a gift card. Blech! I will not be coming back to Red Robin in Morgan Hill, Chili's, Chevy's and Famous Dave's in Gilroy. Moving down here made me a better cook, these are the times I miss living in San Jose.

The hostess and the server were really nice. We just came from San Francisco and were headed back to LA when we stopped to have dinner. There was a wait for our table when there were plenty of empty tables available, but we didn't mind. The server (Luke?) Was really polite. He got our drinks right away and took our order with no problem. The wait for the food was a little long, but we didn't mind. The food was OK compared to the Red Robin in our hood, but we still didn't mind any of these issues because we had just come from camping in Yosemite and before Red Robin we stopped at two different restaurants with the worse service ever!!! One location was coming down from Yosemite and the. Other was in SF on pier 49. So it was very relieving to have nice people help us this time.

Not the best experience. Since its a chain it all taste the same to me... So all I can talk about is the service. Although sweet, our waitress was so slow and forgot everything we asked for.  Random people dropped off food for us, including the hostess and she forgot about the stuff we asked for too. Maybe an off night but red robin is usually staffed very well. This place needs some help.

I have been to other Red Robin's and had good experiences. Not at this one. I ordered their "Gourmet Cheese Burger". I am not sure what was gourmet about it, I have had much better. My wife had a southwest chicken salad. The chicken was dry and way over spiced (it was caked on). As other people have noted it took forever to get the food. We could see the kitchen staff. There seemed to be plenty of cooks and the place was not busy. My burger sat under the warming lights for quite a while waiting for the salad.  The person preparing the salads did not appear to be in a hurry. Not going back there again!

If possible this rating would be a 0 star. Red robin being one of the last restaurants open in town my friends and I decided to stop in for food before heading home to San Francisco. Upon ordering drinks the waiter began to give one of my friends attitude because he was proving his age with a passport because he didn't have his I.D. She told us she needed to ask her manager & we were okay with that. When she came back she not only was giving us attitude but started arguing with us. She then told us the manager approved the passport and my friend could order a drink, but she told us she wasn't going to allow it. It was an experience that definitely left a bitter taste in my mouth & it wasn't something we expected at all. Since she became rude and argumentative we no longer wanted to stay and eat there seeing as she was the only waitress so we decided to leave. I'm sure this red robin is not always like this, but it was still a terrible experience. Ps. The waitress name was Lori or Tori

Waited to be seated, they do not believe in having a host/hostess.  Finally were seated, but took a good 10+ minutes for anyone to acknowledge is at the table.  We our server came we ordered but were informed they were out of both seafood dishes.  Doesn't matter what the food is like or what the rest of the experience is like ...... Right now Red Robin in Morgan Hill stinks!!!!!  Okay we ordered our second choices.  Order comes to the table and half of it is wrong.  I notice a couple of other tables have problems, too.   Wow!  The service in this place is very poor.  I don't blame front line staff, I BLAME THE RESTAURANT MANAGEMENT TEAM.   There have already been several businesses in the same complex that have closed that were notorious for bad service, I bet at this rate RR will close down soon, if dramatic changes are not made!

What happened to this place??????  The wait was longer than expected. The service was horrible, rude and slow. The food was cold. My son's food came out way before ours came so instead of eating as a family, we watched him eat then vice versa.  Sad.
Love coming here! The service is great & the food is good. Love me some mozzarella sticks!

This place is a joke. Ordered with the waiter asked what temperature we would like our burgers cooked?  I laughed. I said why do you ask they are just going to come out how ever the kitchen wants to cook them. The waiter said nooooo. I can assure you we are so slow even if the kitchen over cooks them we will redo them. Then he comes back and say my manager told me he will make sure they are perfect. Well after all that the burgers came out well done they were ordered medium. If I had money I'd open a family restaurant because there is not one legit restaurant in all of Morgan hill. Chilis is a farggin joke maybe even worse.

If I could leave no stars I would, after a 1/2 hour wait to be seated for a party of 7 (which I can understand due to it being busy) we placed our order and received 2 baskets of fries of which I can literally count a total of 12 fries (both baskets combined!) and that was after the first 20min wait. It then took 15 more min to receive 3 more not full baskets. One hour later we finally received our order after 3 other larger parties that came in after us received their orders before we did. I can only say if you want good burgers drive out of your way to Santa Cruz to Betty's Burgers (don't worry won't take any longer than a wait for these people to get you a napkin) and will save you the head ache of dealing with this place!

Arrived after the lunch rush, tables were dirty and full of dishes.  Service suck and there were hardly customers there. We watched our food from the table sitting on counter to be picked up for about 10 mins. The burgers were great fries where cold.

Stoped in for a late lunch, was busy took 15 minutes from the time we sat down till some one greeted us and asked for drinks. Drinks were good and thats about it. Food took 30 minutes to get and it was cold.  No grilled onions on the prime rib beef dip. When we asked about them 2 times i might ad the showed up after we were finnished eating but.... they were hot fresh out of the microwave.  Service was lacking and unatentive no management was visable.  Should have gone to chilis next door

My boyfriend and I came here for a burger a few weeks back and had the worst experience. The hostess told us the bar area was open seating if seating was available in there. We looked for a table which there were 6 but ALL of them were dirty. We asked if one could be clean and she said the busser was busy and continued on her phone. We walked around the bar area to see if one had gotten cleaned but no. During this time staff is just passing us by and passing all these dirty tables by, while other guest are waiting to sit in the bar as well. Finally the busser gets to them, he was probably the only one in there working hard that night. I ordered a root beer and decided I wanted a root beer float instead so the waitress who is also the bartender brought me a cup of ice cream to pour my root been into, other waiters see it spilling all over as I'm trying to pour it and don't even offer napkins as I'm trying to clean it with only one. It took forever to get our order taken, food to come out, and to get any assistance from our waitress since she was also busy at the bar. The waiters who were in the bar area saw out red light on and just walked past our table with the "that's not my table" attitude. The food came out and was cold and just thrown together. Our waitress never came around to ask for refills or more fries on the so called bottomless. I can continue to complain about staff but at the end of the day this review falls on the management. If there is a need they should be there to make sure it is met. No manager was anywhere to be found to make sure the restaurant was running smoothly and the guest were happy. Under staffed and the staff that was there were not motivated to do there job except for the busser who was trying his hardest to get the job done.

Wait staff is unfocused and inattentive to customers.  Four wait staff congregated at podium entrance chatting and laughing while tables need busing and cleaning.  We were told to "stand by the table and wait".  Obviously disrespectful to management when asked to get tables ready for customers. Dirty menus with old food stuck on the pages, customer seats are left wet after wipe down, old dried food on serving utensils. What does this tell u about the sanitation of the food being served?

I was at this place last week.  It was my first time and had an excellent service from the waiter.  I was so impressed, she was very attentive, polite  and pleasant.  She deserve to be an "Employee of the Month."  However, by the time that I am leaving, the few of the other staff was chatting by the entrance podium without saying, "thank you for coming" something like that to tell your customers.  Also encourage us to come back.  That's all that I could say.  Thanks!

I was on my way home after a long day of working and being stuck in traffic. This was my first time eating at this place. I placed an order online for pickup. Order was supposed to be ready at 6:20 pm. My order was not ready until 7 pm. Very disappointed. It was a Friday evening and the place was packed. I understand it was very busy, but if an order is placed online and it tells me it will be ready by a certain time, then it should be ready at that time. Staff was friendly. Food was delicous. If it hadn't been for the long wait, I would have given this restaurant 5 stars.

Service at this location is the worst...went in for Saturday night dinner.  Place was moderately busy but not too crowded. Waiter seemed courteous at first but then ignored us rest of our visit. Food arrived with cold fries which were very few in quantity we asked immediately for refill, after three requests to three different servers who didn't seem to give a crap...we finally got a handful more by that time the burgers were cold. Drink was never refilled or offered... go spend your money elsewhere... McDonald's would of been a better choice than this lousy location! Never again setting foot into this place !!

I've been here three times.  The first about a month ago we received amazing service. They brought out our fries before our meals which was great and they brought refills without us having to ask.  The last two times the servers were inattentive and the food took over 30 mins to arrive.  We weren't asked if we wanted refills on anything.  I guess that first time with good service was a fluke.  One star for the service last month.

Service here is horrible, no one gave us water or anything for a long time. When we had to ask two times someone finally came. Our food took forever to come out. Even when it came out it was cold.  Management needs to restructure and become organized. No one knows what they are doing it's like a chicken with their heads cut off.

Our waiter Jarrod was very attentive. I had a lot of questions about the menu and he answered them in depth. We also had quite a few alterations to our order and everything came to the table the way we asked. Food came out fairly quickly. I got the DGB with no tomatoes but onions instead. I also asked the waiter for avocado on the side. Everything was delicious! Hubby got the Mac and cheese burger... Unlike mine it is not one of their "premium burgers". It comes on a regular bun instead of ciabatta and the burger is smaller/thinner/not as juicy. The price difference is about $7 and it is definitely worth the extra for a better dining experience.

This was the worst expierence!   We started off with one server and we were told that she needed to go home because she was over hours. She never left and just started waiting on other tables. We asked for water it took them over a half an hour to bring water. We ordered our food and when we got it, my son ended up with the hair in his food. They  delivered some food and five minutes later they delivered the rest of our food. It was cold and tasteless. We called the manager over and it took her over five minutes to come to our table.  When the manager arrived we told her what the situation was and she had a total attitude telling us that she would remake the food. There was no way we were going to have our food remade  especially with the hair in the food. Terrible service, terrible manager, terrible food!

We have eaten at Red Robin in San Jose for years and struggled with the service and thus food quality despite an appealing menu for the kids.  Endless fries and good shakes are always winners....  But the negatives including very very crowded all the time kept us away from this eatery. However, Red Robin in Morgan Hill is a HUGE winner.  Service is outstanding each time we go and the endless fries come out immediately.  We are asked how we are doing by roving servers in addition to our own attentive server.  I have nothing but high praise for Red Robin in Morgan Hill.

This place has awful service, they are slow and when they throw on a extra charge they laugh it off and say "we are really swamped, will just give you your money back" Oh jeez don't do me any favors I didn't order or receive the item seriously save yourself 2 1/2 hours of chaos and go somewhere else!

Brought my daughter here for belated birthday dinner her 1st time an my like 5th time our server today was AWESOME she funny an very sweet!! We came in perfect time because after we done the big crowed come in.

I've been here many times. I've had my rehearsal dinner here and family gatherings. The wait was only 15 min. And for large groups that's pretty good. Ive had other place take 30min or more. If you seen my reviews you know i dont mind to wait if its worth it. The waiters and waitresses always welcoming and friendly. Ive never had a problem with the staff. The most popular appetizer is the onion rings and they're bomb. A must try. I've had the whiskey river bbq burgers, avocado and bacon burger, the zucchini appetizers oh my God everything is so rich and flavorful. Oh and you can order the whiskey bbq burger with beef or chicken. How cool is that.   Choices are key when it comes to burgers for sure. Whenever we are eating we are always asked if we need anything else or fresher drinks. I love it here. I've experienced many a places that have difficulty with the staff at a certain time of day. This place I have to say doesn't have that problem. I've came in the afternoon I've came in the evenings.   The food is always a long wait here so thats a definite BEWARE. But this restaurant is always poppin' SO red robin Morgan Hill...give yourselves a pat on the back.

Terrible service! We waited 20 minutes just for drinks then another hour for water refills, still no soft drink refills 1 1/2 hours later when the food came COLD. All while another waitress sat and chatted it up with her friends in the booth next to us!

- This place is a joke. -- Terrible service. Terrible service. -- The waiter named Jared is awful.   I had to ask him far too many times to please speak loudly because He Chose to speak softly even though the place was so noisy.   Passive-aggressive. -- Music is Way, Way Too Loud. -- It took 20 minutes to get a draft beer. -- It took 30 minutes after the beer to be served our meals. -- The place was NOT busy. -- We had to ask for silverware and napkins... and then they were sort of "dropped" at the table. -- Stop with the shouting and hollering for someone's birthday.  It benefits no one. -- Even the foursome at the table behind us had most of their food "comped" by the manager because of the awful service, cold food and loud noise. -- At our table we were only too happy to leave, and the manager ''comped" one beer. - As we told the manager, we'll never return to this or any other Red Robin restaurant.

There was a long wait for a table, like 20 minutes. I asked the waitress if they had any non-alcoholic beer. The waitress laughed at me and said no. I don't know what's so funny about wanting a non-alcoholic beer. I asked if she's SURE you don't have any because most restaurants have it. She said she's sure they don't have it.  So I walked over to the bar and ordered a non-alcoholic beer and they did indeed have it. I went back to my table with it and when the waitress came around again, I showed it to her and said this is a non-alcoholic beer. The waitress said "I don't know anything about beer." I pointed out to the waitress that she said she was sure they didn't have it. The waitress responded "I'm new here" First off, I don't appreciate a waitress laughing at me because of my drink selection. Second, I expect a waitress at a restaurant to know the entire menu, including the drink menu. If a waitress isn't sure whether they have a certain drink or not, she should CHECK instead of telling me she's sure you don't have it, when she really has no idea what you have or don't have.  I find the service insulting. As for the food, I ordered the A.1. Peppercorn Burger which is $11. It took the food a long time to come out, and mine was served cold. The peppercorn sauce had no taste. I was expecting something spicy or tangy or something, but it was very bland. It tasted nothing like peppercorn.

Wow , you know how stingy I am with the 5 star reviews but this chain burger place had it all. Super ,out of this world ,customer service Clean establishment Friendly -happy -atmosphere  Fast service Yummy drinks Yummy vegetarian burgers I don't get out this way much but I will make sure to stop by for lunch. Also just a note, I have read some people have had really slow service or bad service here.. I am wondering if it depends on floor and kitchen staff changes? We had the manager come by and ask us if everything was to our liking even. Perhaps with our visit we were just fortunate mananger was on floor? Now I am wondering.
This mix drink is a must try !  it's the bomb
Brittney is the SH&$. The bees knees. If you stop by, do yourself a favor and sit in the bar.

I don't know what to say . The food was so bad that we could not eat it . We orders a chicken burger which was flavorless , the fries were old and tasted like shhhh. The onion rings were made in oil that was never changed since 1920, will never go back again .

Rating this restaurant a 1 is most definitely an overshot. It took at least 45 minutes to get our food after ordering. One burger was not only burnt, it was missing most of the ingredients as listed in the menu. The second burger was also burnt..:black around the edges. Neither burger was hot..:slightly warm at best. We each took a bite of the burger and it was hands down the worst burger we had ever had. We promptly paid our bill leaving a bite only out of the burgers and went to In and Out which is where we should have gone in the first place. We will never patron this restaurant again!!! Food in not quality and service is way too slow!
Thank you Athena.  Your professionalism and patience made for a great family birthday get together.

This location wasn't as good on service but I always like Red Robin. The thing I love most about red robin is they offer gluten free buns. My favorite hamburger is the nacho crunch burger. Their French fries are really good with the seasoning. The shakes are really good also.

The food was delicious.  The service was extremely slow. The waitress was really nice and friendly.  Every one enjoyed there food, very tasty. Bottomless fries, but service was to slow to get more. The kids had endless drinks but service was to slow to get more. We asked for sugar, lemon, and hot sauce and never got it (we asked twice).
Lisa Marie was a great server she came to our table quite frequently to see if needed anything , food was great and fast !

I will never come here again Brooke was an awesome server that's after I booted  the original server. She was horrible. And the only reason I gave this review a three-star Brooke made up for it but if I had Brooke to begin with I would have gave it 5

HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE. This experience has been the worst one yet.  My boyfriend called to order our food, only to be put on hold for at least 15/20 minutes and had to hang up and call back. After asking to speak to the manager he was able to order our food. He was asked specifically if he wanted his burger cooked all the way or with pink in the middle, his answer was "burn it." He likes it crispy.  After picking up our food and bringing it home, I didn't even want to eat it. Not only was all of our food COLD AND SOGGY, his burger had pink in the middle and was partly raw. My chicken sandwich was not cooked all the way and had a good chunk of fat on it, I had to stop eating it. Also for a place that has "bottomless fries with a burger" in the Togo orders they are HELLA STINGY with their fries, we are not happy whatsoever. After a long stressful day this was absolutely the icing on the cake. WE WILL NEVER USE TOGO ORDERING OR GO OUT TO EAT HERE EVER AGAIN. I would rather drive all the way to San Jose.  Complete waste of 40$.
My wife and I had a pretty miserable experience.. Food was cold  I sent it back 15 minutes later recieve another cold burger .. BAD service...

Had lunch with a couple co-workers today and had great service. Our waitress greeted us quickly and asked if we wanted something to drink. She brought us waters and took our food order thereafter. Our food came quickly and everything was cooked correctly.

I love RR, but wish I have checked Yelp before stepping in to this house of horror service. What a nightmare of visit. I never expected to wait more than an hour to get service. After the waiter even fumbled the simple task of handing us the bill I asked her if this is normal to wait so long - I got the excellent reply "I said I'm sorry".

After posting a lengthily review of my experience on Yelp, I was contacted by (what I assume was a manager) via the yelp review asking me for my contact information.  I forwarded this to them and never heard back from anybody. Oh well........ Just to make sure others can see my original reply that was minimized by this current update, I've cut and pasted the review here: Decided to eat at Chili's off Cochran in Morgan Hill.  As we drove up we saw a large group of people in the foyer.  Didn't know if they were waiting or leaving, so we decided to drive next door to Red Robin instead. It was Sunday night at 8:00 PM.  Walked in and there was no hostess for over a minute.  We were the only ones in the Foyer.   As we were standing there, other employees passed us without any acknowledgment.  The place was kind-a of busy but the first thing that we noticed was so many tables were empty but need to be bused from the past guests on both side of the premises, bar and main dinging room.  Finally young women (Hostess) walked up with wind-blown hair and greeted us.  Her hair was so frazzled it was like she just flew in from a hang glider......Not very professional nor kept! We were seated and five minutes later our waitress came over and said she'd be right back. Ten minutes later she came to take our drink order.  She must have been pretty new as she didn't know the prices of the import draft beers nor the condiments on the burgers listed in the menu.  We placed our order and waited another ten minutes for our drinks to arrive.  Side note; all the tables that need to be bused still remained.  See pictures.  Another twenty minutes went by and our waitress came over and surprisingly dropped off a basket of fries and apologized for the wait.  She scurried off.  We grabbed the ketchup from our table and it was empty.  I went over to another table a retrieved another from a vacant (un-bussed table) but it was empty too.  I finally found a half way full bottle and duped our fries.  The fries were absolutely room temp cold.  Needless to say we didn't eat them.  Also to be mentioned as we were waiting, I noticed that one of the cooks (in the kitchen) with long dark hair did not have a hat of cap on. I think this might be a requirement of food staff........ More time passed and our waitress never came back.  The wind- swept hostess was busy making red balloons and remained much focused on her little task.  As other people entered the restaurant they too had to wait in the foyer.  It was now 45 minutes since we'd been seated, the tables around us still remained to be bused and oh yeah, never a manager around. At our fifty minute mark without any food and cold fries, I decided to leave.  I left money with the hostess for our drinks and we left. Drove across the freeway and ate drive through at In-N-Out Burger.  Way better and no drama nor wait! I haven't worked in the food service industry for quite some time, but if this was my establishment heads would be rolling.  I would hate to have a review like this one on my property.

On our way to Monterey and needed to stop for lunch. We love the Red Robin in Sparks, NV so we decided to stop in Morgan Hill to eat. It didn't look to busy just by judging from the number of cars in the parking lot but we waited about 10 minutes to get seated. After being seated I noticed that there were more dirty tables than clean tables. Only two servers and no bus boy.  Our server Cynthia was very nice but only checked on us once throughout our lunch. The food was good but nothing special. As we were leaving I noticed that the same tables that were dirty were still not clean. I just feel like they were understaffed.
No eggs for 6 months???? But they don't advise on the menu or when ordering they just hope you won't notice ?!?! NEVER going back I should have checked the reviews first 2.5 stars is a stretch!!!

I'm very disappointed with my visit at Red Robin's today. The server took was only working with like 3 to 4 tables and she took forever to bring us our food.  And I asked for a refill on fries and it took her  20 min to bring them to me and the fries where  drenched in oil. The server Megan was very rude.

Very disappointed. Service was poor. Burger was ordered medium but was more on the well side. For an Angus burger, beef looked very dense and most likely previously frozen.
