For the endless fries, it took 45 minutes to get served a second order. For not being even close to being busy (there was more employees there than patrons), this is just unacceptable.

To start we have enjoyed eating at a variety of Red Robin restaurants. This one was the worst we've ever been to. Others had warned me but we decided to give it a try. Even the water tastes bad in this place. The service is slow, the food is mediocre.  When we sat down they told us they were short staffed. The servers and hostess were working hard. From all the dirty tables I have to assume they didn't have anyone to clean the tables. I would recommend that the manager who was walking around, half heartedly asking each table how their meal was, could have pitched in and cleared some tables.  We were really hungry so we ordered chips which didn't come until after we got our entrees. They were kind enough to take them back to the kitchen. We had burgers which were just ok. When our burgers arrived I realized we didn't have napkins or utensils so we waited, staring at our burgers for a bit. They did return with the silverware and napkins but unfortunately only forks. I needed a knife. More waiting. They brought our table of four 1 knife which we all shared to cut our food.  The people that work here are polite but it doesn't make up for waiting too long for a just ok burger. I wouldn't recommend you stop here. Would be better off at a fast food burger place.

First time here, probably my last. The "bottomless fries" thing is a joke, I swear each serving was like 10 fries. Burger was tasty but small. My daughter got a fruit salad that looked like it was days old. Very disappointing since the commercials kinda draw you in. Best part of meal? The 2 Blue Moons I had.
Good food. Consistent quality. Not for calorie counters. Clean. Service is so-so. If in the area and asked, "where do you wanna go?"  This would be a good choice. Can be very busy on werkends.

So me and my guys go to this Red Robin all the time. But this time was a terrible experience, food is usually very good and consistent.  I ordered ceaser salad and tortilla soup, ceaser was mostly croutons  the soup had gobs of cheese, like 90% cheese ........gross. It took 20 minutes for us to get the beer we ordered at the beginning of the meal our server took our order dropped off our food and never came back The restraint wasn't bissy? No management ever came buy we had to  get up from Our table and ask for the check and then again to pay. There is no such thing as bottomless Frys at this location Unless you have lora or Derek as a server.

Every time I come into this restaurant I hope the experience is better. It just isn't. I order the same item every time I eat at Red Robin, the Whiskey River BBQ Wrap, and each time it's placed in front of me the preparation is different. Is the chicken supposed to be hot or cold? Is the lettuce supposed to be hot or cold? Should the cheese be melted? Is there supposed to be ranch or BBQ on it? This place is so inconsistent that I don't know how my entree is intended to be prepared.  The servers are nice, but the service is bad. There just isn't good communication between the servers and their guests. It takes WAY too long to get your food at this location and when you do it's sub-par at best. I often find myself twisting around in my seat to find someone, ANYONE, who can give me the status of my order/refill a drink/drop off some fries because my food is taking faaaar too long to get to my table. This could be mostly alleviated if the servers were better at stopping off at their tables and communicating with their guests. It's also frustrating that after a bad experience the server will drop off the bill without apology or attempting to make the customer happy. A free round of drinks, dessert, entree really goes a long way after a poor dining experience.  Management needs to step it up at this location.  The new decor is nice, but it's just lipstick on the pig.

I LOVE Red Robin however this Red a Robin has defiantly fallen off. The services is terrible, the hostess didn't say hello or write down our name. When we asked if she wanted it she said "no I will remember you". Seems to have no management and always a handful of people working but no one ever seems to be doing much.

Been here a few times. Waiting for you food can take a lot of time or a little time (it varies). I recommended not coming during a rush. Because when I did it took over 40 minutes to get my food. Other than that my experiences here have been great. Luke, Carissa, and Riane are awesome servers here. They were all very polite and helpful. They have vegan and vegetarian options. It was delicious!
Looked like a good place to eat and have a brew.  Food was wonderful and so was the brew !!

Good food BUT: Very limited menu.  They say endless fries but the service is soooooo slow you can never get more than one basket unless you order extra at the same time you order your food.   To go orders are a joke.   You definitely aren't saving any time!

I love red robins, but this place need a real manager that knows how to manage their staff I don't wait long to get sited but the service was horrible they helped a table that got there after we did, they had really bad service they didn't eve n noticed us even though we waited like 20 min... And then we left
Cheese fries...wow!  These fries are enormous !  Smothered in cheese, thousand island dressing and bacon...interesting artwork and great server.  Friendly and accommodating!

Weight was ridiculous for food, sat 45 min before getting food, might as well have waited to be seated .  Ordered kids food first but didn't come out until all good was available.  Tables were 2/3 full but food prepared like it was over sold.  Don't know if they were short staffed but ridiculous weight.... Some people got their food before others as well

First I wish I could zero stars! I couldn't believe the service that We had waiter Jacob  was watching tv while we were ordering our food. Service was poor all beer on tap was out took forever to get our food. The thing that topped it all off was when we pause our bill our waiter took the money " paid in cash" never returned with our change and after about ten minutes of waiting we found out that he had left this job to go to his other job. This by far the worst service that I've had at this location and it's always bad. I've been to two other red robins and this is the only one that I've ever had a bad experience at.  I'm also calling the cooperate office cause from reading the other yelps on here it doesn't seem to bother the manager him that his store sucks.

It's a family friendly chain.  The food is tasty and the service is pretty good.  It is loud in the main restaurant with children of all ages all over the place.   I do what I can to sit in the bar.  It is a little quieter and the drinks come faster.

The worst Red Robin ever!! 2 hours to get seated and served.  Food showed up overcooked. This is after having a previous experience of discrimination as we watched many many people get seated before seating my family with my daughter who's in a wheelchair.  They weren't prepared to seat a disabled person, or they were simply incompetent.  Red Robin needs to step in and hire a quality restaurant manager.  This place gives the chain a bad name.

Came in for an early dinner, service at bar super slow.  Took 10 minutes to clean table. Ordered double burger, rare with bleu cheese. Cooked well, no bleu cheese at all!  Only thing fast was the bill!  Saw another customer complaining.  Oh- and my sweet potatoe fries cold and over fried. Yuck!
Good dining experience.  Burgers and other items are plentiful.  Burgers were well seasoned and server was attentive, friendly and helpful.   Will come back soon to try other items.

We have been to this Red Robin a few times and for the most part, the place is pretty good.  Except last Saturday, Sept 27, we went there for dinner with a neighbor dinner.  They were busy but what do you expect on a Saturday night.  The waitress was super nice and I can tell she was frustrated with the kitchen.  It took an hour for us to get our food and then 30minutes later the kids food came out.  I made a complain to the manager but he did not seem to care. Kind of disappointed because we like this place.
Pretty good yum. First time had whiskey river bbq burger. Service was ok. Liked the atmosphere.
The food was great, as usual. The waiter was the icing on the cake! James K. Was terrific. He made my daughter feel truly important. Absolute great job!

Have to agree with the other reviews. Very slow service and by the time you get your food, it's cold. When they brought my son's mac and cheese, the server noticed it was congealed and suggested I stir it around. Wow.

Wanted to like this place. It's not that their food sucked but their customer service did. We called in early on a Friday. Came to the bar area to pick up approx 4:15. No one was in there or tending to the two bar flies sitting at the counter. My son and I waited a good 5 mins patiently and finally some young guy comes in, no acknowledgement whatsoever so I tell him we are here for a pick up (I'm not standing here at your cash register waiting to sit with my 11 yr old at the bar. Duh wake up.) still somehow I have a smile on my face.  He slowly gets the food, rings it up and up and barely mutters the total, I give him cash wait for the change and had a $5 out for the tip. When he decided to just dump the change in my hand with no count back, no thank you and not even one word spoken at all I promptly picked my $5 back up. Normally I still tip when its crap service but not today. My kid even picked up on this and agreed totally lack of customer service.

When my husband and I come here, we never have to wait and service is quick. Of course, the food is great as well. We've been to different locations of Red Robin and it has always been a hit or miss on the service. However, the times that we've been to this location...service has always been wonderful. Last night, we had a server who was serving multiple tables...but she managed to come back to each table asking how we are doing and gave us refills on water and fries. We are definitely going to continue coming back to this location when we are carving for a burger and garlic fries!

Joined a party of 27.  Service was crap.  We sat 2 hrs before even got our food.  Tables had no place settings until we were already eating.  Took forever to get our drinks.  After we finally starting getting our food. ..server told us that they ran out of chicken.  Wow really.  Food was cold.  We only had one server until i complained to manager.  She was in shock that we had been sitting so long and that we only had one server.  Well if she had been doin her job...she would've come around and checked in on tables and discovered that we had shitty service.  My first time to this location.  NEVER again.  Very disappointed.  Can't believe I drove all the way out here for this.

Red Robin has been a favorite eating spot for the hubbs and I since college. It is consistent and I think there are some creative menu items. The burgers are tasty and who doesn't love bottomless steak fries? Husband's favorites: peppercorn burger, royal burger Mine: whiskey river chicken burger, mud pie dessert, light tea/lemonade cocktail

No Burger is worth the wait As a large party we registered with the hostess. She gave us an approximate wait time of 30-35 minutes. I was more than happy to wait since I realized we were a large group. As time passed, our wait became just over a hour when I noticed our table who the hostess told us they were setting up was given to a lady who came in after us. When I approached the hostess she said, sorry but your high chairs wouldn't fit at that table which was bull sh*t. The lady behind us b*tched & complained & they straight up gave our table away. I asked to speak to the manager & it was determined the hostess gave our table away he wanted to comp us apitizers. I didnt want free ap so my family & I can eat more unwanted calories. We walked out. Management staff sucks. Red Robin lost my business. We ate at Marie Callendars where they don't discriminate people with children.
The worst service. They brought the food cold and waited to long for the food. I wouldnt come back at all. They brought out the apptetizer almost the same time as the main food

Went on a Saturday night with a party of eleven people. Laura was our server and didn't miss a beat despite our large party and other tables she had. I've been to other locations and have always been a fan of Red Robin. Tried the pretzel bites for the first time. Tasty little morsels. The entire staff was friendly, Laura didn't disappoint. Food was out quick and the drinks were never empty.

I've been here plenty of times. Swore the place off the last time but here I am again tonight. We had a 15 minute wait according to the hostess. Looking around the place I could see several empty tables that hasn't been cleaned yet. After about 20 minutes we were finally seated. The waitress greeted us pretty quickly. She even got our drinks fairly quick as well. It was amazing! Then it went downhill in the typical Morgan Hill Red Robin fashion. I asked the waitress if we could get a basket of fries since right away I had a little one who was hungry. The answer was yes. Of course I knew I wouldn't be getting those fries. I've asked the same question 3 times during my last 3 visits and told yes each time. And all 3 times my request was ignored. Try it if you're reading this. See what happens.  Anyway, the food comes out 25 minutes later. I have a bacon cheeseburger. It's nice and cold. Fries too. We ordered fruit for my son's meal and got fries instead. Happens all the time there though.  Glasses never got re-filled. Waitress hardly checked on us. Had to ask for utensils and napkins. Ketchup bottle was empty.  It just seems this place is massively understaffed. I will never go back there. I have learned my lesson. One lesson I can't seem to learn is that I can make better food at home but still go out and spend $45 for dinner.

Wish I could say better.. First off Paige was a good server. Very nice and friendly... But it was my birthday dinner and it didn't go well... It was a group of 9 so they shoulda given her help... First we couldn't get her back to take the order of someone who showed up a little late.. Then my drink was bottomless but never once refilled even on request... My husband didn't even get his cheesecake .. We had to ask after everyone got their deserts  ... The excuse was " someone took it.." The food was cold .. All of it. We never got fry refills... It wasn't the best experience we ever had. We won't be going back . The one in Santa Clara is the best.

Mind blowing bad experience!  Monday night. 8:00 p.m. Visited this restaurant as it's typically a good deal and ok to bring kids to.  Less than half the restaurant is full.  15 minute wait for a table after the girl at the front said, "I can't help you because I'm trying to get off my shift." No clean silverware at the table because "we are so busy we can't keep up with the dishes"  Server was apologetic up front and said they have been behind all day.  Took our food and drink order.  15+ minutes for the drinks to arrive.  Kids meals arrived promptly (three kids in the party) Our burgers (3 adults) took another 30 minutes to arrive.  Our server explained the kitchen was so behind that the manager was back there helping.  Food finally arrives.  Sweet pot fries are completely burned. When we questioned him about bringing us burned food he said, Ok I'll get you another basket.  Asked for dessert menu for the kids.  15+ minute wait.  Server brings the regular menu and says, we don't have a kids dessert menu. Track him down for the bill. Ask for the manager.  She will come see us "in a few minutes".  She comes out and acts like she has absolutely NO CLUE about the condition of her restaurant.  Asks if we want to sign up for reward cards?!   It's now 10:00 p.m.  The kids are melting.   Manager offers to "see what she can do" about the bill.  At least five minutes later the server returns and says they have removed one meal from the bill.  We pay and leave.  Shocking how clueless and slow and out of it the people in this place were.

Our server T.J. was great. We were seated right away and when we settled in, we were made to feel welcome and comfortable. He did his best to bring everything out as fast as he could and provided a great service. I also liked that the kid's menu had healthy sides such as sliced apples. But then... As the evening wore on, the restaurant got progressively louder. There was a lot of screaming, "What?! What?! I can't hear you," across our table. We finally gave up trying to talk to each other. The restaurant is a large, open area with not much to keep the noise level down.  The food was just okay. The reason it wasn't great was because everything was literally drowning in salt. I thought I was imagining things until I picked up the nutrition guide on the table and it confirmed it. It's a shame because there were a lot of great ingredients in the food with the potential to shine on their own without needing to be overly enhanced with this specific seasoning. People can always add salt if they need more but you sure can't take it away once it's there. I got that, "I could make this better at home," kind of feeling.  I'd come back here for T.J.'s service alone,  and maybe during an off time when there aren't as many people, or if I'm having a raging salt craving, but it won't be my first dining choice when eating out in Morgan Hill.

12/29/14 3:00 PM - Terrible experience, our team has eaten about 1000 meals at Red Robin, Morgan Hill.  Mostly pretty good.  But today, we had to leave after an hour of sitting at our table and not getting our food.  5 Waitresses in the shop, very few customers.  It took about 20 minutes to get drinks after asking three times.  Ordered food at same time and waited for almost 1 hour.  Repeatedly asked several waitresses to check on our food - nothing unusual - Jut burgers and salads.  Each waitress promised she would check and get right back to us.  10 minutes later, nothing.   We watched the manager and the waitresses talking back in the serving area for at least half of that time, having a grand old time.   I think Red Robin corporate needs to visit this place and get it back on track with their good service, not the type of service we've seen today.   By the way, we took the team over to Eriks Deli and have sandwiches and salads in about 5 minutes after arriving.  I guess, it's time to change we we normally go.

We ended up eating here not because we wanted to be here - my tastes are different from the majority of their menu.  But I have to give a big shout out for their broccoli side dish. Granted, you have to like broccoli.  But they have a wonderful way of preparing it here.  It's served in a small bowl like finger food.  The pieces are cut into small flowerets, so it was easy to eat like finger food.  You could see char-broil marks on the sides - an added grilled taste.  Perhaps it was soaked a short while in brine, because I didn't need to add salt.  And it was done exactly right - not squeaky, not limp.  It was a perfect broccoli experience! My veggie burger was also excellent.  But my rhapsody - and 5 stars - is about the broccoli.

Made the mistake of taking my family in here Sunday evening for the following reasons: 1. Understaffed - which led to empty tables with a long wait plus un-bussed tables for us to look at for long periods of time while we were eating. 2. No one greeted us at our table for well over 5 minutes. Maybe 10 minutes. A waiter was walking by and saw that we hadn't been greeted yet, so he would "help us out" and take the table. Sorry, but I don't come to a restaurant and drop almost $50 to be a charity case. 3. During the meal, I asked our server for a refill on my soda. He took my half full cup and placed it on the nearby shelf. I had to wait well over 10 minutes to get another drink. Train your staff to NOT take guests' drinks and to simply bring them a new one when the ask for refills. In the server's defense, I think he was frazzled due to having too many tables which leads us back to short staffing.  * The food was excellent as always though. This unfortunately was not the first time we had super-poor service at this location so giving it 1 star. We won't be going back anytime soon, if ever.

This was worst dining experience I have ever had.  Let's start with how long it took for my party to get our drinks. We sat down, about 15 to 20 minutes for us to even see our waitress to take our drink order. While we were waiting for her to take our drink order, about 5 minutes into sitting there, a random drink shows up. Which wasn't ours since we hadn't even seen our waitress. Finally we put in our drink order. Takes another 10 minutes for us to get them. By this time, a friend of ours left work, went home changed clothes. Drove from Hollister to Morgan Hill to get there in enough time to order his dinner. He put in his order and drink order. So by the time our food gets here, one of my friends food didn't taste like a single thing. He put salt and pepper. Even the fries seasoning. Nothing. We had to flag down the waitress to get her attention. Told her it was terrible. She took his burger and didn't charge him. Btw the person who drove in from Hollister and got there late, she forgot his drink order! He was 1/2 way through his meal before he got his drink. Plus, the drink that was sent over from another table, we also got their food order. She mixed us up with another table. So, this is the part where it really gets bad. We are sitting and sitting and sitting and sitting. Waiting for our check. Btw, we told her it was all separates tabs when we sat down. Now, red robin has tablets at every table where you can split the tab and pay.  As we tried to do this. She messed up everything single tab. She only charged two people of our party for drinks. Others, she added extra appetizers that another person ordered. She even added extra drinks. Once again, we flag her down. Told her we'd like the check. She tells us to use the tablet. We tell her they are messed up. She leaves to fix it. And we wait. And we wait and we wait. And we wait. All of us feeling held hostage cause ALL WE WANT TO DO IS PAY AND LEAVE!!! So I go and find another waitress ask for the manager. She disappears. And we wait and we wait and we wait and we wait. So, finally I find the hostess. Ask her for the manager. She disappears. We wait and wait and we wait. Finally I get up and look for him myself. Found him, sorting through all our checks. Finally I was able to complain and get things straighten out. Plus, all our appetizers were taken off for the wait. Which was nice but the waitress had the nerve to ask us what she did wrong!? She didn't do anything right! I watched other people be seated, get there food, and leave. THEY ARRIVED AFTER US! She waited on them! She did not wait on us at all! Sad thing the bill was about $120 dollars between the 5 of us. We ended up only paying $40! She lost them so much money! We were even planning on buy more alcoholic beverages and desert. Nope! I AM NEVER COMING HERE EVER AGAIN.

Warning warning warning... A very loud alarm is going off!!! Came here for lunch, which was the biggest mistake I did for that day. Wait time 30 minutes. First contact with the wait staff 30 minutes. Food arrived 30 minutes after the order and the burger was raw, really raw I am talking purple meat, nasty! At least I had a bonding moment with the people around me as we all had the same dining experience. Just nuts! I totally regret not going to chillis.... Thank you Morgan Hill red robins, stay classy!

Take out is the absolute worst here and I would not even try it.  I ordered two grilled chicken cobb salads for take out last night and they were horrible.  The bottom side of the grilled chicken still had some kind of skin on it and the color was a lovely gray.  A small amount of lettuce and some ingredients missing.   Gray chicken, no lettuce and some toppings missing for a price of $12 per salad and food poisoning for free .  We had not eaten here in awhile due to poor quality food and thought we could try again.  We will never eat here ever again and unthinkable that they would pass off chicken that looked like that to a customer.  I would give them no stars if I could or subtract them for dangerous food.  Eat here at your own risk!!

Horrible service.  I won't be coming back. It's not the first time at this red robin. Other times its been busy but tonight no excuse.  For two people and a baby i shouldn't have to wait for 40min. Also i asked for my check for Just the drinks, yes they took care of them rightfully so but the manager couldn't even come and apologize.  Oh well, Ajay's cheese steaks has better burgers anyway.

I came here for a birthday lunch, and the service was great!  Since it was before the lunch rush, the servers were able to put a table together pretty quickly for a party of 11 people. Everyone in my group already knew what they wanted to order, so we had our drink and burgers written down on a piece of paper.  The server understood that we didn't want to spend long at lunch, so he was very accommodating.  All of our drinks came out pretty quick.  When someone finished their freckled lemonade, it seemed like the server was already bringing a new one! Our food came out about 20 minutes after putting in the order.  I ordered a Garden burger with no sauce.  It was actually ok.  I've had better ones at The Counter..lol.  The steak fries was hot and crispy.  Since they were bottomless, my friends were able to get more fries. =) When it was time to light the cake, the server helped us find a lighter.  He even gave us the bill pretty fast.  I liked that we didn't have to flag him down..lol. Overall, the food is ok and a bit overpriced, since a burger cost about 10 bucks.  If you join their eClub, you'll get a free burger on your birthday!!

It's a chain. Good burgers, good service, good milkshakes. I had a burger with ghost pepper sauce, fried jalapenos and fresh jalapenos.  It still wasn't hot enough. Luckily, my woman was with me, she made the entire place hotter. Ya feel me?
Poor service during lunch! Place wasn't busy!!! Asked 3times for a box to go. They were busy talking and laughing to help us. Not happy....

location: East San Jose, San Jose, CA
review: I use to love this place. I would drive all the way from San Jose. Lately it has been by far not worth my time. My burgers have been cold and service has been horrible. I'm not sure if management has changed or what but they have lost my business forever after today's last fiasco!!!!

Came here to have some beers and dinner service was amazing that was because of Brittany the only bartender serving the whole restaurant. The only thing I didn't like is her manager in charged yelling at her in front of customers when she wasn't able to get to her register to close out of something. You have amazing customer service Brittany thank you for serving me.

3 stars because of inconsistency. Food is supurb sometimes! Sometimes sloppy. Burgers are delicious I love the royal red robin, the whiskey BBQ. The arctic cod fish sticks are soo bland, the batter is delicious but the cod needs some seasoning a little salt and pepper would be great!! My wife's chicken sandwich burger was incredible on Sunday evening & my arctic cod sticks were battered incredibly but no seasoning and bland, I figure it was just an error on a busy day in the kitchen.  We went back a few days later to try the same as my wife was digging her chicken sandwich burger. I got the cod again..... Same ol same ol bland not seasoned, and my wife's chicken burger was falling apart the batter was coming off and they messed up on the toppings. Just inconsistent. Service is pretty consistent though and they have friendly people. To your success!

I could not believe how bad it was on my last visit. It was like half the staff no showed for the day. 1. Packed waiting area and no host to be seen. 2. When host did arrive she turned her back to everyone and started looking at her iPad. People had to say something to her to get her to put their name on the list. We put in our names and we were told 20 min wait. It was 1:00 on a Sunday so I figured not to bad.  3. Looking around the restaurant and counting the number of empty/dirty tables and I was shocked. There were 14 dirty tables and with a full waiting area you think they would put some hustle in their step. NOPE they are moving like snails. The servers walk by dirty tables over and over again. I get it, it's not your job but I think you would want more tips and the longer we wait the smaller the tips get....... 4. 35 minutes later with 3 clean tables in the place (yes still 14 dirty ones) we get seated. I am not over stating anything when I say 14 dirty tables, the table right next to the waiting area was dirty from the moment we walked in to the moment we left. 5. We are seated, starving, and with a hungry 6 year old so we want to order now. Takes the server almost 10 minutes to come to our table. There is a table to our right complaining that it has taken 30 minutes to get their check and a table to our left that keeps asking for the manager. We order everything the moment he arrives. 6. Order is:  Soda, Tea (extra lemon), kids lemonade, and chocolate shake. Kids spaghetti, Blue Burger, and a red robin burger.  When we got the drinks there was 1 lemon wedge and the shake had no whip cream & no tin with extra. When my Blue Burger arrived it had burnt onion strings. The server did get me new onion strings but that is a big fail at quality control. He never asked if we wanted refills on our drinks.  7. Check please! We asked for boxes and the check as soon as we could. Another 10 minutes to get the check.  8. And last but no least, the bathrooms. I'm lucky that there was a roll sitting on the handicap bar. There were empty rolls on the floor. Garbage can overflowing. You can ell no one had been in there in HOURS. As I'm washing my hands the hostess walks out washes her hands and leaves. Not a care that the bathroom look like a tornado went off.  This location used to be great but the quality of staff and food is way below mediocre especially when you are paying over $40.00 for 2 adults and 1 child.

This Red Robin has never disappointed when I have gone there.Went there for the fourth time last week and it was amazing as always.Was seated as soon as we got there and food was served to us in about fifteen minutes shortly after we were seated :) Best burger there is the sauteed 'shroom,so great for those mushroom lovers out there,it will not disappoint!Also,the freckled lemonade is very good,has a little something that gives it more flavor than regular lemonade.I highly recommend this place to anyone who is in search of a good burger with a great atmosphere!

Worst restaurant experience I've had in a long time. The staff and management were horribly inefficient, from the wait to be seated (with a large number of dirty tables that were still dirty when we left, to having to wait 20 minutes for a knife, to bringing me my meal incorrect THREE times and it wasn't even fit for consumption when it arrived. Go to Chili's, save yourself some time and blood pressure medication.
This place has the worst service. Waited an hour before walking out . We had a party of two and a child and never got our food. We ended up walking out

Bottomless fries and drinks.... that alone is a big winner. I would swap my fries for  Sweet Potato fries, but thats just my preference. Burgers are of course great. if none appeals to you, you can always start to substitute things. just dont get upset when the order does not come out exactly the way you mention it to your server, just give them props for trying.
Our server (Brittney) was very kind, funny and knowledgable. The food was typical, nothing too special hence the 4 stars, but the server really did make up for it.

We went here last night for the first and last time. The food itself wasn't awful, but it wasn't anything worth coming back for. The service was even worse. My husband (who also reviewed) asked if they sell non-alcoholic beer and the waitress laughed at him and said no. When she returned later to take our food order, he asked her again if she was absolutely sure they don't have any non-alcoholic beer, and she said she was sure they didn't.  I don't get the attitude at all. First of all, it's really rude to laugh in the face of someone placing an order.  Second, isn't it in the waitstaff's best interest to get the customer's bill as  high as possible? How do you think tips are calculated? He ended up walking over to the bar and paying for the beer over there (because yes, they actually DO serve it). That's four dollars off our bill, so more money off her tip (well, in addition to the money he deducted for the terrible service. Seriously- don't laugh at your customers).  When she returned he showed her the beer and not only was she totally flippant about stating she was sure before, she didn't offer any apology for her attitude and said she was "new here."  I have waited tables before, and while I understand completely it takes a while to learn the menu, how hard is it to ask the bartender which beers are available if you're not sure? Instead she chose to be lazy and insult her customers, and we won't be back.

Service is fast and friendly for the most part. Nice and clean - good place for families to eat on the cheap. Only had one bad experience here: they lost our order and our waiter didn't let us know it was being remade. Waiting over an hour is not cool when you have a small child. However, when I spoke to the manager, she was extremely apologetic, comped our meal, and gave us a GC for our next visit. I figure everyone can make a mistake, and the Red Robin's folks worked hard to rectify theirs, so kudos to them. Only reason not a 5 star is because they stopped giving free baskets of fries prior to your meal arriving. That was always a plus and kept the kids mellow.

Ordered my burger in the 5th inning, finally got it after the game was over. It sat on the shelf while the entire kitchen staff watched the Giants game. I wish I got to stop working any time baseball was on tv. Didn't get a refill on my "bottomless" fries and my burger was cold. Will not return here.

If you enjoy cold burgers and confining small hungry children to a booth for over an hour, Red Robin Morgan Hill is the place for you!!! Seriously, watching my five year old cry over the congealed layer of cheese on her macaroni was priceless. Thanks for a great night with the fam!!!

Group of 5 two tables down sat after us and had their meal a flu 10 minutes before us two.  There was something I couldn't bite through in my chicken sandwich.  They took it back and said it was the skin of an onion.  (I'm not buying that!)  I couldn't eat it, and they took it off the bill, but did nothing to remedy my bad experience- not even offer a free appetizer!  So disgusted! We were there to celebrate several occasions, but all we could think about was the bad service and food.  Yuck, and never again!

Really slow service.  This could have been an issue with our server.  We had to ask for refills of water. One of our orders arrived at the table incomplete.  We were not able to get the attention of our server.

I took my brother here yesterday as he had never been.  I told him what a great burger we could get there so he was in.  When we walked into the bar there were several tables empty but not cleaned off, when we finally had a server come to our table, 5 minutes later, I asked for a Coors light and was told they were out.  HOW CAN YOU BE OUT OF COORS LIGHT???  so we went ahead an ordered, my brother got the fish & Chips and I ordered the Bleu burger (the server did not ask how I wanted that cooked) so it came well done and NO blue cheese to be found.  It was not very tasty and the Fish and Chips batter sucked.  I don't think I will be back here anytime soon.

I've been here several times over the years and the experience is just sort of mediocre. The hostesses just don't seem very serious when you walk in. My sister's response to this is just, "It's RED ROBIN!" Yeah, it's Red Robin, they should have hostesses that can communicate to patrons that come in. They sort of acknowledge you and mumble something about to follow them and then return to their booths to continue their gossip. Food is ALWAYS subpar. It's cheap, and you get what you pay for.

Cheese was dried hard on top of my cold fries, Burger must've been sitting out at least half hour before they brought it to my table it was cold also! Food took over a hour to bring out for three people. Our waitress Hailey checked on us two times in the time of us being there. Had to re-order fries just to get them warm! Staff was unfriendly and seemed to be nervous for some reason? Was better off eating next-door at dickeys barbecue restaurant. First horrible experience at this place.

Like many of the Yelpers here have mentioned.. It's takes FOREVER to get your food! Like seriously and I only ordered fish and chips! How hard is that to make. And when you do get your food it's not even good.. The fish was WAY over battered and the fries were cold and limp. I went here on a craving for their fish and chips, all the other red robins always have it on point! I don't understand how you can mess it up. And our waitress didn't even give us a glimmer of hope to when our food would arrive.. She asked us if we were doing ok, I wanted to be like "yea this water sure is great" but I decided to hold my tongue. Step it up PLEASE!

Feel like place has taken a down turn. Got two burgers and bottomless sides which could be good, but was vastly disappointed. Food took a long time to get out. While it was filling, food quality was poor. Not enough avocado (it was miniscule at best), soggy buns, and messy apperances. Had to ask for sides and other things. While these may seem like small issues, they can really prevent a positive experience. I will likely not be returning to red robin unless at the request of a colleague.

I'm not a fan!! I know I know...I've been 3 times I think & I just don't like it. I mean I can see how peeps do but it just doesn't do it for me. :\ The bottomless fries are a perk but not enough to keep me coming back..the burgers always fall apart & are sloppy & they just don't taste fresh to me...like say In & Out does, know what I mean?  So, its a no-go....for me.

I usually try to avoid chain restaurants, but there are a lot of things I like here so we've been back a few times. I love that you can sub either a boca burger or a garden burger for any of the selections on the burger menu (at no charge).   Bottomless fries with your meal (and they have a neat assortment of dipping sauce).  They actually have some good beer on tap (Lagunitas!) which I found surprising, I'm used to chain restaurants overdoing it with Coors/Bud/Crapbeer, it's refreshing to see more variety.  I would give three stars based on the food, but we always receive great service, so four stars it is!

The rating is actually a big fat zero. Slowest service ever, waited about 30 minutes for food, nothing hot.  Had to ask for water & drink & fries refills.  Told them we had a birthday at our table, they forgot.  The hostess used the back of my chair as an arm rest while talking to a different table and server, so when I leaned back I hit her arm with my head and she just walked away. STAY AWAY for sure!

Gosh.. Been here three times and every time it has taken a very long time to receive food. As for the bottomless fries, every time we ask for more it takes another long time to get it. I work in a very fast pace restaurant and I can understand delays, but it seems I've just came at the wrong times because it's been a third time and I wasn't so pleased :( However, the waitresses are very nice. Hostess was not very welcoming.

I love a good root beer float and when they never end that's a pretty sweet deal!!  My burger was disappointing however. The fried jalapeños were soggy, I was expecting it to be spicier but it was not. I know what I'm getting but for the price I can get a better burger elsewhere.  It is consistent however so there's that.
I love the food here and the fries are so good! I normally get the burger that has teriyaki sauce and pineapple slices. One of the best places for burgers.
Good food I've never had a problem with it. But the service at this location is absolutely terrible. They're all over the place and very forgetful.

RR is weapon of choice when the french fry craving attacks - where else can you get unlimited fries to eat to your delight??? RR has the Tavern burger which is basically a smaller burger - pretty delicious and makes me feel like I can eat like a man when I finish it...yeahhhh!   Not many great dining choices in Morgan Hill but when you need AC relief and want to commit carbocide..

I've been to this particular location 3 times and each time the service has been beyond slow! It will take at least 10 minutes for you to be greeted for beverage orders. Reason I give this a 2 instead of a 1 is because the food is what you ask for, nothing special.

Very poor service at 530 on a Saturday night. Went there in hopes of a nice 5th birthday celebration. Informed hostess and server, they did nothing.  $69 with tip for kids mac and cheese, kids grilled cheese sandwich, wings, salad, burger, milk, two margaritas. Very bad value

The food is really good but wow is the service ever so slow...sat at the bar - 2 tenders running bar, hardly anyone there & the two of them seemed to have difficulty keeping up. Friendly and polite and nice atmosphere but don't be in a hurry

I wish I could give them zero star!!!!We had to walk out of this place with yet another disappointing service! But this time WE GOT NO SERVIC!!!! We sat and waited for 25 minutes, no one came to us so we walked out .. This place is only getting worse in service.. Hate to have to do this to our local business but they just pushed me to right a negative review!

We ordered our food and away went the waitress. We waited... and waited..and waited. It finally came and the fries were cold, and one of the burgers was over cooked. We told the waitress and she took the burger, left the fries. When she returned she had a delicious looking burger, and yummy hot fries for the whole family. All in all, it's a Red Robin.

Would have given three and a half for mediocre burger, but the service killed that idea. Every step of our meal took twice as long as it needed to. Also, we paid extra for garlic fries and were then served (half an hour later) regular fries. It may sound petty but after waiting forever to gat a refill on the iced tea I was irritated. Did I mention there were three other tables in the dining room and about six people working the floor? Red Robin should be renamed Red Flag!
Its been 20 minutes and i still don't have my soda but my waitress has time to watch the Giants game...

A long overdue review... I stopped in here a few months ago after I had been in a car accident and was waiting for a tow truck.  I wish I had payed better attention to get the name of the girl who seated and took care of me that day - she was awesome.  I know I was visibly shaking, and she immediately seated me and went to bring me a coke (I've been told this helps prevent shock... no idea why).  I ordered some food, and she even brought me some fries to nibble on while I was waiting.  She checked on me regularly, and was just really great about making sure I knew I could sit there as long as I needed.  The food was good too!  Can't say enough how much I appreciated her that day.  That bit of caring she showed to a total stranger may not seem like much to some, but it sure meant a lot to me.

Can I give 0 stars? Worst dinning experience in a long time....speaking of a long time . I'm sitting here for over 45 min and just received the food mine dry little flavor, the wife no flaver not even appetizing. Very bad again.. won't ever be back at the Morgan Hill red robin.

Worst Red Robin ever hosts and waiters are very nice but food takes for ever they have serious issues in the kitchen. Several years back they were fine but in the last year we have gone 3 times and we wait an average of an hour for food after its ordered. Today my daughters veggie burger was cold, and yes we waited at least 50 minutes. The table next to us the lady found a long hair in her burger.  I saw another table get so made from waiting they just got up and left.

My girlfriend and i came in tonight to have dinner and we were blown away with how good of a server kayla was she got everything we ordered down to a t and was such a delightful lady that id have to say she should be server of the year. Thank you red robin for the great food and even better service cant wait to come back! :)

This place was horrible!! There were four of us (two adults and two kids). When first getting seated, I had to ask for a towel to clean off my sticky chair. Another table sat down about 15 minutes after we did and our waitress Monica- who was hard to find already- took their order before ours. This was about 20 minutes in. We waited another 5 minutes and I had to flag down a manager to get any attention to have our orders taken... And the manager didn't even come over!! We still had to wait for the waitress to come over. Then with four of us at the table she left us with only two sets of silverware. I had to flag down another girl to bring us more and had to send he back to get more because she only brought one set after being asked for two. When our food finally came, it was awful. My boyfriend asked for his burger medium, it was well done. My burger was burnt and didn't have the bacon it was supposed to come with and one of our girls had grilled cheese bites and the cheese wasn't even melted! Needless t say we will absolutely not be back. I've been a server for over 10 years and this is probably the worst I've ever experienced. I don't even usually write these, but this was definitely warranted.

Not our night for food at the Rd Robin. We called ahead to ask for a spot for a handicapped walker and was told they were not busy so just come in. When we got there, no tables with chairs were available and we were told to wait 10 minutes. When we were seated, and ordered, the food was not hot, in fact it was cool. Sent it back. Before the food showed up, we asked while we waited a long time, if we could get some fries that came with the meal while we waited. And we waited again. Slow service. The food was just OK. We have been in the restaurant before and did not have a great experience, so this is our last time.

Red Robin is just okay. It's a burger place more than anything. And, it's not a great burger place. Not a bad one either. Just okay. It's a large place and great for groups. It's very family friendly. We had a baby and two young boys in our group. Their noise level fit right in. Since I had burgers two meals in a row, I opted for the fish and chips. It was pretty good. I was very satisfied with it. Most people got burgers, my wife included. She got the Cry Baby which has ghost pepper chili on it. She said it had a kick, but wasn't too hot. This means the amount of ghost chili had to be super tiny. I had the bottomless strawberry lemonade. It was really good, and each glass was loaded with real pieces of strawberry. I went through like five of them. A decent meal, but nothing to brag too much about.

I bought a Red Robin gift card for my sister in law to use because she was babysitting my son Saturday 8/22/15. She had her family (young adults) join them for dinner, so there were 5 of them. At the end of the meal she paid on their electronic tablet device with the gift card and the remaining balance with her credit card. As they were in the parking lot, the staff ran out after them accusing them of not paying. She showed them her receipt yet they insisted she come back inside the restaurant. Once they further viewed the receipt they allowed her to leave, yet kept her receipt. They gave her a sheepish apology. I just now learned about this, am am absolutely horrified. She is a 1st grade school teacher, barely makes a living, was treating her family to what she thought would be a fun time with their cousin and instead got treated like a thug. I have bought gift cards for this place in the past, but never again and will never go to Morgan Hill Red Robin. The place is doomed.

The food is fantastic as usual. The bottomless fries are not so bottomless. When you go empty, it can take a considerable amount of time to get more. Not necessarily a deal breaker, but that is supposed to be what they're known for....

Never had an issue at this place. Always greeted at he door and even if there was a wait on a busy night, just watch a little Sports in the floor (you'll know what I mean when you go there) :) Food is always what you can expect for a place like this Burgers are great and the beer (lots on tap!!) comes cold in frosty glasses!!! A PLUS!! Bottomless steak fries (I like the Garlic) are great. Try the seasoning that is on the table....BUENO! GREAT for kids. Mine have always left with a balloon in their hands and a smile on their little faces!

Richard, oh Richard.  Come here and get the bartender to be your server.  Super prompt on drinks.  Mmmmmmmm.  Even though I did get a Freckled Lemonade which tastes rather close to a Strawberry Lemonade at Sweet Tomatoes, whatevs.  I had a bbq something chicken something sandwich something whiskey river.  I thought, it would be delicious!  I love chicken!  and I love barbeque!  But it seemed to lack...barbeque.  Hrmmmmm.   Nice service though, whoo!

Let me say the food was good but the service was horrible. Drinks came out pretty quick and that was it. Appetizers took too long by the time they arrived they were room temperature. Then the meals came out less than five minutes later. Our waiter remembered to ask the booth in front of us if they wanted more of the bottomless fries and the booth to the right of us also but ignored us the whole time. Plus the menu never said about charging for the Thai sauce but the waiter decides to come after the order to tell us. "We never charged for the sauce the whole time we've been open but we were supposed to. So my manager wants me to charge you for it." WTF???? This was the first time I never left a tip. My bill was 42 and some change I would have left at least 10.00 for the tip if this wouldn't of happened. You shouldn't judge a book by its cover aholes. Oh yeah I'm writing corporate also!

Update!  So I was contacted a few days after my last review by Trinna Mikel the assistant general manager and I was glad that she took notice. I was given a $20 dollar gift card to come back and see if my experience would be any better this time around and as reluctant as I was I decided to give it another shot and thankfully my experience was much better this time. The service was a hundred times better thanks! :)

The service here was fantastic during my visit!  Richard was totally awesome and gets an A+!  Richard was courteous and way on top of things, like bringing drink refills without needing to be prompted when he noticed that our drinks were running low.   The food is good but could be better in my opinion.  I had the honey mustard chicken sandwich.  There was only a very thin layer of guacamole and barely any honey mustard sauce for the exception of the first bite.  Everything else was good.  I had the bottomless peachberry fruit cooler, which was also pretty tasty.

Typically I love this place...  Just not today. Today it's ok.  Nothing to special, just ok.   Why? Ok... so part of it's my fault.  I tried to swing by with a co worker during our hour long lunch break, only we were a bit short on time, since it took us a good 15-20 minutes before we decided to head out of the office. That leaves us with 45minutes top for lunch. Now this place opens around 11, and we had lunch just around that time, so we were in-fact one of the first through the door.  Moving forward we'll call in our order but today was a learning opportunity, so well... we didn't. Now we know. I was dropped off at the front door, as my co worker parked.  I tried to open the door while holding my purse, umbrella,  and something else important I'm sure.  To my dismay, the hostess stood watching; as I nearly dropped everything trying to open the door.  Had I not have been afraid of destroying my hair in the rain, I would have dropped my umbrella, but this was not an option. Hostess= 1 star. Upon being seated we were quickly ready to order, unfortunately we had to wait while the waiter checked on two other tables, and input their orders, before even taking our drink order.  I used to wait, and this took way too long. Finally, I mentioned to the server, that we were in a bit of a hurry.  He asked if I wanted my appetizer first, responded with whatever get's it here fastest.  Fastest. Faster. Most Fast.  Um.... If I've already mentioned that I'm in a hurry, and I ask for the fastest method; then why does my food take 20 minutes? Why does my appetizer come out with my food, piping hot from the fryer, when it could have been fried from the get go in 3mins?   And finally.... Why was I able to see my food at the counter, being passed up by waiter after waiter, rather being immediately brought to my table? Yeah... What a waste.  We literally scarfed down our lunch in 8minutes.  Yumm... Not. You cant even taste it when you eat that fast :( Also Bottomless fries, are only good if they give you more than like 10 per person.  Why be skimpy?  They're bottomless, darn it! Typically service rocks my socks, but today... not so much.

Went tonight with my wife and her friend, as i has enjoyed RR in San Jose on numerous occasions - at RR Morgan Hill we experienced extremely poor, slow service. 40 minutes and the food arrived luke warm.Then staff dont come near you in case you order more bottomless fries.... Spoke to Manager - inexperience was very apparent. No comps offered, but said he will tell kitchen staff to be quicker in the future. I now work in Morgan Hill, so thank goodness they have a Chilis....Red Robin Morgan Hill  not worth the trouble. If you need RR fix, drive to the one in San Jose

I love Red Robin, and since this is the closest one to Monterey, we stop by when we get the chance. Usually the food is outstanding, but my bf's burger came out overcooked and his onions had part of the peel on it still.  The fries are always good and my Cobb salad was fantastic. Steve was our server and although he was very busy, he did a great job.

Food took an hour, and even still my well done burger was the color of the tomatoes. My friends side of "steamed" broccoli was cold and almost raw. Our waitress had a horrible attitude. Never cleared away empty plates, glasses, etc.  Stop here only if you have to.

We got the worse service ever experienced. Service sucked the place was dirty, bottomless fries never came. Anything you ask for takes 15 minutes to get. You ask for dip for the appetizer but the appetizer is gone 15 minutes later when they brought out the dip. Pig out burger had 1/4 slice of bacon, chicken Ensenada was dry, ask for refills on drink or fries and It takes 15 minutes, never did get more fries. Was charged for the free kids birthday burger. The only reason my grandson wanted to come on his birthday Is they have TV on the floor. Guess what TV is broken, the floors didn't look like they had been swept all day, trash can in bathroom was overflowing didn't look like it had been emptied all day. Gross, manager sucks. They have plenty of good competition here in Morgan Hill, they won't last long, get us a red robin worth eating at.

I went here a little while back, but I'm only writing a review now, and I apologize to the Yelp deities.   A friend and I came in here after work (around 9:30 pm?) and we split a burger.  Don't ask me what kind of burger it was.  All I know it was VERY large (large enough for two people to split and still be full) and VERY delicious.  Pair that with the freckled lemonade, bottomless steak fries and I'm a happy gal.   We got the burger medium rare, and it was perfect.  The bun was delicious, the toppings were perfect in amount and flavor and the fries were equally fantastic, even though I'm not usually a fan of steak fries.   I can't say much for the ambiance since We were literally the only people there.  I felt kind of bad, since we were in there past closing, but they were very accommodating  and I very much appreciated that. I'll definitely be back whenever I'm in the mood for sit-in burgers =]

We went here for a late dinner after buying a car. Sat down our waiter took our drink order and 15 mins later they came. Our appetizer came before our drinks. I could see a salad sitting on the counter from where I was sitting. My cheese burger came out before my salad. My salad that I ordered cam out once I was done with my dinner. I sent it back and our server never brought us a check. I had to flag some one down just to pay the bill to go home.

For a large group, we received excellent service. Our server, Jason, was very attentive.   My Chophouse Burger was pretty darn good - a little kick from the horseradish.  A good experience overall with the consistency one should expect from a chain restaurant.
Service is extremely slow - not a one time experience thus this review. Food is what you'd expect from any big box burger chain fresh out of a stucco gun.

4 stars for the fact that management replaced my meal and also took it iff the bill.  I had ordered the riblets with mac n cheese and the meat was dried up and the mac n cheese was dry as well. The manager exchanged my meal and didn't charge. (:

Received a call from their HQ saying that they apologize for the negative experience and they want to invite me back for a meal, on them, and sent me a $25 gift card One of these days I may use it but I'm not very eager to go back. The whole experience was blah and the other staff, not my waitress, were unprofessional.

I wasn't really looking to have another plain burger at one of the many burger places out there, but this place exceeded my expectations. I'm glad we decided to stop here on our way home from San Jose. The place was nicely decorated and the food was quite tasty. No complaints about anything not even the service, our waitress was very helpful and informative. We decided on the banzai burger and chicken breasts with salads. Opted out of bottomless fries as much as was tempted. We also tried a raspberry oreo shake in monster size which we shared per recommendation, delish! Will definitely be back when in the area. Too bad we don't have one closer!

We decided to give Red Robin one more try.  I wish there was a minus stars option for this restaurant.  Waited 25 minutes for food, unbelievable since no one was in the restaurant.  I asked the server if we should leave were they closing, since it took so long for her to come from behind the bar to take our order.  She said no they were open for another 25 minutes. We should have left, cold disgusting over cooked (burned) burgers arrived.  Fries that had obviously been under a heat lamp for a while.  Food and service were atrocious!  There was no one in the restaurant, manager you should be ashamed. Close earlier or get  a better crew that wants to be there.   We left a tip that I hope sends a message, although if this is standard food and service, she probably did not get it.

Had Kyle as a waiter today. He was great, everything was fast and easy. Great garden burger, compliments to the chef. Everyone in restaurant were working very hard and busy. Everything is clean and comfortable!

I'm not a fan! My vege burger was horrible... whatever sauce they put on it, is disgusting!  Even after wiping it off, I could still taste it wayyyy too much, blah!  The service is very slow (at least on a busy Friday night).  My kids BEGGED us to go here, instead of taking them to our usual spot (with kids) -- Sweet Tomatoes.  The kids meals are expensive, for the junk food they get.  Our server was friendly, but they definitely could have used more staff the night we were there.  I'd go again if a group was going, and this was the meeting spot... but, I won't be going out of my way to eat here again anytime soon ;) The iced tea that I ordered was terrible tasting also, so I sent it back, and asked for water... but, it was still left on the bill, at the end :/

I came my whole family 14 of us. It took 20 min to get drinks, another 30 min to get artichoke dip and 45 min to get our food. 5 out of 14 meals where cold( 4 kids Mac n cheese and one Burger). Waited another 9 min to get silverware, refills on drinks, warm food for the kids, new burger and a completely disturbed night.  Service sucked Food sucked  Manager super nice but dinner experience ruined even though he didn't charge us for those meals.   :(

First time coming to this red robins location. I usually don't eat here because I don't think it's that special. They have a lot of different burgers so that's a plus. However the service needs to improve.  Came here with a couple of other people on what looked like a slow night. After we got our food, the waiter disappeared on us. What's the point of having bottomless fries if they don't even bother to check if you want a refill. They make you wait forever so you will get tired of waiting and just want to leave. And it's not like the fries are so special Overall decent burger, bad service, fries mediocre.  Also this was on a slow night. I'd hate to show up on a busy night...

This was my first time at Red Robin and we were here originally to get dessert after 15 miles bike ride from San Jose. Instead we ordered appetizer and they were great. The Onion ring was good, I am not a fan of the fires and sweet potato fries are nice even though it was greasy. The waitress was awesome and she make sure we get our food together and follow up on my daughter mac n cheese.

One of the best yummiest burgers in town. Who doesn't like bottomless fries? I guess if your don't you can replace with sweet potato fries, vegie sticks, or salad. We have always had good wait service, not much if anything to complain about.

My husband and I took our three grandson's to Red Robin on Saturday March 9th. It was the middle one's 9th birthday and he requested to go to there. We should have walked out when our waitress came to our table and said have you been here before I am trying to get out of here and showed us the device on the table to order ourselves. We were unable to order ourselves as the device was broken she came back after 10 minutes and took our drink order. The boys of course wanted the all you can drink root beer floats. When she dropped off the drinks she took our order and we did not see her for a while everyone needed refills by this time. Someone else dropped off out food. We had no silverware and my husbands order was wrong. It took a while to get someone to acknowledge us as they were all back there chit chatting We had someone else bring us silverware then our waitress came and asked if we wanted refills. I told her my husband did not order sweet potatoes fries and would like regular fries. He did not get the fries until long after he was done with his meal. I pointed out that we were charged for the sweet potatoes fries she said she would take care of it took the bill. When she returned it was still wrong. I just paid for it. Our bottomless french fries never happened the endless root beer floats never happened. The whole experience was a let down especially for our grandson whose birthday it was. I don't think I will ever go back to this location or any for that matter.

Pretty much what you would expect from a chain burger restaurant. Average service & food. On this particular visit, we found our waiter to be  either tired or bored. We did enjoy the chophouse burger though.

I've been to this location a few times and the service usually isn't too bad, but also isn't great. The last time I was there, the service was terrible and there was almost nobody else in there eating! Food- 3.5 stars Service- 2 stars Decor- 4 stars(compared to Eastridge location) Food was pretty good as usual. Not the best burgers but pretty good for a quick meal. Burger was cooked with a little bit of pink as requested and the fries were good as usual. BOTTOMLESS FRIES YAAAAYYYYYY! Now the service, there was only 2 other parties in there, WHY MUST YOU NEGLECT US?!?! Everything was ok until we got our food. I was hungry, it was hot outside, I just wanted to bury my face into my delicious Royal Red Robin burger BUT WAIT! I don't have any napkins. I can't eat without any napkins. What if I get my face hella sauced up, what I am going to do? So we waited, and waited, and waited and then finally our waiter! We ask for napkins and then back to waiting, still waiting, oh yeah napkins..........So we finish our meal and I pay with my card. He brings back the receipt and my buddy asks for a refill. I grab my card and look for a pen to sign the receipt but no pen, should I just leave? lol 10min pass by and no refill, no pen, and nobody around. We eventually get our refill and a pen but didn't leave too happy, full, but just a little annoyed.  I want to give this place a 2 star rating based on my last visit but this was the first time I've experienced service like that here. Food is pretty much the same at all Red Robin's so nothing to worry about there.

Every single time we resort to coming here it is the same: Servers are very sweet, but the actual service is inconsistent.  We were both servers, in fact I was a server for over a decade and I am absolutely shocked to see the amount of servers going to the back without full hands (meaning they have pre-bussed a table) and coming out of the kitchen without full hands, meaning they are not bringing food out. The result for the customer is a table full of empty glasses and dirty dishes, and that your food has been waiting so long to be delivered after cooking that it is just warm at best when it comes to the table.  My former managers at the various restaurants I have worked at would never have allowed this. Getting the food out hot was one of the top priorities even if the food you were delivering was to a table that was not yours. The server should be in tuned to the guests' needs even if the those needs are not outwardly expressed.That means if someone has a kid, get them in and out as quickly as possible or ask if they can fire up a kids meal asap. This means bringing refills out even if a guest doesn't ask for them.  we asked for refills, and they were never brought. It seems to me that the management could help guide the servers as to how to manage their sections more like one big table rather than individual tables. For instance get all the drinks at once, get refills at once, refill waters all at once and even refill waters in a station next to yours for another server, clear dishes all at once etc... Management could teach servers how to multi task when they are going in an out of the kitchen by making sure that everyone has full hands in and full hands out. I worked at a restaurant where we were not even allowed to go into the kitchen without bringing something back from the tables and not allowed to come out of the kitchen without something to deliver out to a table. Bottom line is they have a staff that is friendly and wants to please people but just need the tools and guidance on how to do this better. These are easy simple fixes that don't take a lot of time, but vastly improve the quality of the food and service.   Needless to say we won't be back after so many not so great experiences. The two stars given are solely for the staff's sweet disposition and the kitchen who I am sure puts hot food out on the line before it sits there for 10 or 15 minutes getting cold
Wooooooowwwww...insane!!!! Management is horrible! This place is so dirty! Every "clean" table isn't even wiped down. The poor servers are spread way to thin and look very overwhelmed.

We've been to the place 5x and it never fails.  To seat 2 people, it take 20 minutes + even if the restaurant is half full due to lack of servers.   Even when we get seated, our waitress walk by our table without any acknowledgement for at least 10 minutes.    I definitely will not come back anytime soon and wouldn't recommend this place to any who is really hungry and wanted a quick bite.

5 stars simply because the server Laura is fantastic and gives a great dining experience. Red Robin isn't all that different from the Chili's literally less than a minute away in menu choices and atmosphere, but we still go to Red Robin due to good experiences having Laura as our server and making dinner more fun and interactive than at any other chain restaurants.

Although the food was good, the servers weren't so great. My family and I were celebrating a birthday here. I arrived later than everyone else and they had already finished their meals. I placed an order and asked the waitress if I could get it to go. She said sure. Since the bill had already come, she needed to add my burger on. So she took the bill back and disappeared for about 15 mins. When she came back the burger had been added. It seemed like forever to get my burger. I swear it was at least 30 mins. She had passed our table several times and never offered to check on my meal until we finally flagged her down and asked her about it. She apologized and trotted off to the kitchen, but not before I reminded her it needed to be in a "to go" box.  Viola! My burger finally comes out. On a plate. I sent it back and reminded them it was "to go" for the 3rd time. They apologized and finally brought the burger out in a box. My family our waitress was having a hard time earlier, they had to ask for refills on their drinks several times before she got around to it. I wouldn't have left a huge tip. Don't think I'll be back anytime soon.

The server was very new and needed more training. He was very curios and polite but defiantly needed more training. We sat down to order and right away ordered my niece's dinner (1yr olds get hungry fast) along with our drinks. Took 15 mins to get the drinks. 40 mins to get our food. Received our salads at the same time as our food but didn't get my niece's food till after everyone had their food....very frustrating. My sisters food was completely wrong. But what made it worse was the manager comes over to hear our complaints and he throws the server under the bus...REALLY? I have never heard of that. Very unprofessional didn't comp my sisters meal comps the kids meal. Then the manager goes over and ripped the server at the servers station where everyone could see!! So unprofessional. None of this would have happened if the manager would have trained his servers properly. After talking to the manager again he finally comped my sisters meal and took off salad and gave us 10% they did make it good in the end...maybe it was just a bad night for Red Robbin but I will think twice about coming back here again....

Pretty darn good burgers.  Several good appetizers.  Service is sometimes quite good -- sometimes just o.k..  Pretty good beer selection, bottle and on tap.  Way better burgers than settling for fast food, so I'm glad there's one in Morgan Hill.  Not an awesome place, but I know what to expect and they usually deliver it.  Can't say I ever had a BAD experience.  So, I guess I'm a fan.

Worst service ever. Got sat at 6:40, received burgers at 7:30. Burgers were over cooked, cold, very little fries asked for refill never got them. So much for bottomless. Horrible service, food and management.

I was worried that the service was rated slow.  We ended up going on a busy day, but we were seated quickly and our waitress came right away and took our drink orders and came back around for our meal orders shortly after.  We got our drinks quickly, appetizers were hot and our burgers came out timely.  Our two-year old really liked the mac and cheese and she's normally fussy when it's noisy but she enjoyed the place.  4 STARS.  I dropped it 1 star because I ordered their largest burger and it wasn't as big as advertised, but it was still good.  Also, the fries DO come out slow, but it's really fresh so they were pippin' hot.  The manager (possibly owner) came by to check on us which was nice.  Will go back again.

Our waitress was horrible!!!!!! Due to the fact she was horrible, we got our food room temperature - although we had ordered before a table that sat down after us, they got all 5 of their foods while we barely got 2 out of 5. Then she only gave us forks, no knives knowing we ordered chicken burger and salad which requires a knife to cut our meat. My husband didn't want to wait for her so he started eating and used his fork to cut his chicken, but I waited and she didn't even apologize for her lack of service. She didn't refill any of our drinks not even water. When she gave us the bill, I gave it to the nearest waitress because we needed to get out of there. She came back with our check and a special drink that she made for my kids because she heard how upset we were oh yeah and she gave us a loyalty card to make up for it as well. The past two visits the service has been crappy!!! I was hoping the manager would stop by to check on how we were doing so I can tell him how pathetic our waitress was, but not once did a manager stop by.
Food was delicious and our server, Marie, was efficient and friendly. Other servers also helped out. Definitely plan to go back! Best fried clams in California!
Okay I've had much better service and experiences since my original review.  Here's to hoping they keep up the good work...
Made a quick stop yesterday afternoon after a long drive from Oakland & slow moving traffic-ordered a  strawberry shake and was delish!! I'll be back to try fried jalapeños and burgers
Good staff mostly. Great bar and mixed drinks selection. Decent food.

I will never stop at this Red Robin ever again. My family and I stopped here on our way home from a concert at Great America, it was late (9:45ish), and all of us were tired. There were 5 of us. The place was pretty empty. I spotted a round booth which was empty and asked to be seated there. The hostess told me no because the server was overwhelmed, then took about five minutes to clean off a round table near the restrooms in the middle of traffic. As she sat us she asked, "is this ok?". The booth I wanted was still empty. After being seated I noticed another party of five seated in the booth I wanted, with drinks in hand and no drinks at our table. When the food finally arrived the fries were warm and stale tasting and my wife's salad took longer to come out then the rest of our food and her chicken was burned. Meanwhile the party in the booth were paying and leaving as my wife started on her salad and I began to eat my mediocre $10.00 burger and stale cold fries.  Do not go to this Red Robin.

We were seated immediately so we hoped for a great experience. Our waiter showed up to take our drink order and we ordered appetizers at the same time. The drinks came quickly but our mozzarella sticks..... Not so quick! They showed up and were merely warm, and only 5 minutes ahead of our meal. When we had ordered our food, we were advised that avocado is $1 additional (no problem with that) but when I get the check, make sure you hadn't charged me even more and hoped I didn't look. And as our food arrived we were advised that the "regular" dipping sauce we had ordered would be charged 75¢. Please don't think I am being cheap and nit picky cause the cost doesn't matter to us, its the quality of service that was sorely lacking. The manager never once came by to see how our experience was even though the restaurant was empty and our server asked the two occupied tables around us if they wanted more fries but failed to wonder if we might enjoy some more. Not coming to this one again!
The food is good. The service is a little slow. Especially when it comes to ordering to-go.

Chicken tasted like rubber, must have been cooked yesterday and reheated. Brought the wrong side dish and said he would get bring our side salads but never did. Service extremely slow, waited 20 minutes for our check, no one ever came by and took our plates. Had to ask for refills for the kids, utensils and napkins....we have been there several times, food and service is very hit and miss. Will start going back to Chilli's next door.

This Red Robin was mediocre. The servers are really not that good here. I remember going in early with my family when there were only two other customers there, and  it took over an hour to get our food. Then the food was alright, didn't taste bad but it didn't taste that great. The milkshakes taste amazing though, especially the mint. I suggest going there if you want a tasty dessert.

Finally got to hook up with my brother and his family for a Saturday night dinner.  We met over at Red Robin at 5:30pm and got on the list for a party of 9, they quoted us a 20-30 minute wait.  After about an hour, we were seated (it was crowded so we gave them a pass on this).  After we sat down and ordered drinks, the service was very slow.  The waitress had several tables so this was obviously a breakdown in management on their part.  We ordered and the food took the better part of an hour to be delivered.  The food was fair/good (burgers, onion rings, fries).   Average experience, will most likely go somewhere else next time we want burgers.

This is a 5 star in terms of Red Robin restaurants because we usually are not impressed with the service at these places. We had a group of 10 people and 2 babies, it took about 10 minutes for them to put a table that large together for us, and it was BUSY! Not bad at all!  Our service was great, food was perfect. No complaints whatsoever!

My husband and I went here after having terrible service at Chilis - we usually eat here with our kids so we wanted a change of scenery since the kids were home. We walked in and were seated right away. A few minutes later our waitress (Danielle) greeted us and quickly got us some strong drinks!!  After we had time to enjoy some of our drink we placed our order and relaxed.  The manager brought us our food and asked if everything was going well - YUP!  We enjoyed our super tasty burgers and more drinks and then were offered dessert, which we declined since we were stuffed! The staff were all wonderful The food was excellent The drinks were YUMMY!

I went on line and filled out the "survey" and received a response right away from a district manager, Chris. (the 4 stars are for him and his response) I really felt he heard what I had to say and that he cared enough about the issues to follow up with the local restaurant. (in fact he had already been in touch with them and done some coaching) He asked me to stop back in and give them another chance. I will and then I will update.
