Could not figure out how to order online so had to call. Called in the order for my office holiday lunch. Read the order to the phone person and she read it back. Went into get the order and left. Get back to the office and they are missing the soup, side of fries and an entire burger meal. So back I go while my burger gets cold and I miss my own holiday lunch with my staff. Get there and have to wait for them to make the missing items. The lady comes out and says she did not think I even paid for the extra burger. I said fine get me the itemized list and lets go over it so I can pay for it. She said it was no problem. (so why did she even say it) Got back to make the last 5 minutes of lunch with my staff and a re-micro waved burger/fries... YUK... TRAIN YOUR STAFF..... The person that took the phone order did a good job going back over it so why is it that the person that brought me the order did not take 30 seconds to do the same? Would have saved me a lot of hassle, time and frustration. Been to this location about 6 times before to eat in house and it was always good. Price for a burger is a bit high but not bad. Since there is another place next door to you that also serves burgers you would think that Red Robins would try to out do them with better service. I guess I will phone order my office lunch from the competition next door as you have lost my business now.
Used to be pretty good but has gone downhill lately.   Dirty silverware, and you have to ask for it - they never seem to have enough for some reason.  Food coming out cold after taking forever.

Although I don't think the food here is super duper spectacular, I have always had good experiences everytime I've eaten here. It is a chain, of course, so they have typical burger-chain fare, i.e. sandwiches, shakes, salads, burgers (of course), fries, etc. As far as chains go, however, Red Robin is by far one of my top picks. It's hands down better than Chile's (and there is one located very close to this location), Applebee's, or any of the other "American" food chain restaurants. I think the staff at this Red Robin are also excellent. I'm perplexed by all the negative reviews. For me, it takes quite a bit of negative points for me to give a place one-star, and the experience of other yelpers don't seem to be worthy of that. Oh well, I will return to Red Robin when I'm in the mood for some American-fare!

The staff here are always pleasant. I have to acknowledge Derrik for doing such an amazing job.   The kitchen staff were on the slow side, which gave us more time to talk at the table, but Derrik noticed we were hungry and brought fries for us to snack on.  Also, he kept us updated frequently on our order. I always appreciate that since customers are at the mercy of the wait staff.  Thank you for your kindness and great customer service Derrik!! 2/09/14 7pm
Love Red Robbin, love their steak fries along with their burgers. Ive been there a few times and have gotten great service. Definately will be going back.

Ive always liked Rd Rbn since they can turn any burger into a vegetarian one. Every time I have gone service had been decent and Ive never waited more than 25 minutes for my food to come out. I think sitting in the bar area makes service faster for some reason.
Food was good/typical but the service was terrible. Had to remind staff to refill drinks, ask several times for condiments and fry refills.

Seriously... this place could not have worse service or be any more filthy. If it weren't for my kids I would never step foot in this place. The chairs and tables are covered in slop from previous customers. Our table tents are sticky with rancid bbq sauce. We waited 18 minutes for napkins and silverware.

THIS IS THE WORST SERVICE AND RESTAURANT MANAGEMENT I HAVE EVER ATTENDED!!!! Wow could not even explain to you how much time it took for out food to be brought to us. At least 45 minutes. And I also witnessed a cook grab a hand full of fries WITH IS BARE HAND and put them onto a entree plate and the server even served them without any problem. THIS RESTAURANT SHOULD BE SHIT DOWN FOR PUBLIC HEALTH REASON! Oh an another thing. Never ask for there buffalo sauce. First they have to go to the "back" and "make it". Second the sauce looks like shit. Extremely oily what they call "butter". This was just such an awful experience for me because red robin is my favorite place to eat! Update: 5/2016 Despite previous experiences, my family has eaten at the MH location and others a few times since my last comments. Our recent experiences at the MH location up to last week have been mixed. On two early lunch time visits the service was extremely slow despite the relatively small lunchtime crowd. The food was fine and the service though slow was attentive to the needs of the table. Another dinner visit started out fine. The place wasn't busy (~50% capacity) and service was slow but good enough. The order was messed up or the food was prepared incorrectly (missing items). Asking the server for clarification didn't help. We were told that the food item was prepared correctly and that we were probably mistaken... That's possible.  Jump to last week.  For a treat we decided to eat out and my kids voted for RR. We went early to avoid past problems. We were seated right away and had a great waiter that got us started immediately with drinks. The table and seats were quite dirty and littered with crumbs and smudges from the previous diners. My daughter took her first sip from her water and the straw blocked... thinking it was ice tried again and got what looked like a piece of pickle (we hope) in her mouth. The food came and again one of the items was prepared incorrectly or was completely misrepresented in the menu. Asking for clarification on this occasion was answered almost exactly the same way. The Ketchup at the table was empty and the one we got from a neighboring empty table was so greasy it had to be wiped down with a napkin to be held. My fingers looked wet. The well-done burger patties on two of the sandwiches were burned on one side (truly burned). An attempt was made to hide it under the cheese and abnormally large amounts of sauce. I couldn't eat mine.  In short, the server was attentive but unaffected by questions about the quality of the food preparation. The table was dirty the dishes were dirty and the food burned. I left a full tip, at least two half-full plates and probably left for the last time. 1/31/2015 I love Red Robin's burgers and fish 'n chips.  I try to keep an open mind  when it comes to reviews because we are more likely to be motivated to voice a complaint than praise. However, last night was beyond belief.  I've taken my family to the MH location for a couple of years  and eaten at the restaurant at locations all over the US. The menu and service is generally good or on par with other restaurants of this type. But in this case with the MH location  I've been steadily and increasingly disappointed with the service.  Last night was a busy  Friday night.  We were prepared for a long wait.  We weren't well enough prepared.  We ordered after a long wait.  We asked for utensils  which we didn't have.  An hour later we had had our drinks refilled  once but my son had to leave to go to work without eating. The food came about 20 min later.  It was cold.  We still didn't have eating utensils or drink refills. After asking our waiter twice and another waitress for utensils, my wife got up and walked back to the prep station to find him. He said he'd get them  but continued for some minutes with whatever else he was doing. I found a waitress who finally got us something to eat with.  Our waiter came along 15 minutes later with drinks and a Sheepish grin. We began our cold  meal 30 minutes after the food came.  The food was ok but would have been good or great if warm.  The sad thing is we were not alone. Some tables got up and left in frustration.  Needless to say that was our last visit to the MH location.
What can I say? If you go here, you know exactly what you're getting into. The burgers are big and full of flavor, the fries are always great, and they actually have a decent bar.

Let me tell you about this delicious dream I had at Red Robins that turned into a nightmare. My dad, his girlfriend and I got here at 7:25 pm, got seated at 8 pm. Ordered our food at 8:07 pm, waiter was very nice and friendly (Casii).He kept coming to us to tell us our food was coming.... but never came. We saw people that sat way after us eating already. I called him over to complain about it and he said, " oh yeah your right.." He then disappeared for 10 minutes. Then the manager came out with fries for a sorry gift.. The point is that we waited nearly 2 hours just for California Chicken burger with fries, Black & Bleu Burger with fries, & Soup with Salad.. Not worth the wait. Never again will I go here.

This is the WORST run Red Robin I have ever seen.  We placed a to go order at 5:52 and the bar staff said it would take 20 minutes.  40 minutes later we got our food except I say the kitchen staff put it in the Togo containers without using gloves.  Not only is the service horrible but it is a very unsanitary restaurant as well!  I will never go back!

The last time i ate at this specific red robin my experience was TERRIBLE. First off, my mom & i were meeting my dad there so he was at a table for 10 minutes before we got there, no one asked him if he wanted something to drink or introduced themselves as our server, after we got there the hostess had to take our order, i ordered a burger well done without cheese, we got our order my meat was pink and had cheese, we had to get up and ask the kitchen for our own utencils, extra bbq sauce and never even got a server!!! The manager didnt even come out and appologize or ask us about what was going on! Such bad service.

Terrible service. Waiting 1hour for food and 3 fries arrive. Riblets were equivalent to one rib chopped sitting on fries for $9. Veggie pattie came out cold. Food comes out at different times. I wonder how this place stays open. This is my first ever review of anything but it is so bad I have to report.

Great Service!! I have only been to a Red Robin a couple of times before and this was my first time at this location. Entrance was clean, greeted promptly by the hostess, seated quickly, and server was with us immediately. We had lunch there around 1:30pm it wasn't too busy. Drinks came out quickly and the food came out just the way I ordered it. Every time my cup was empty our server was there with another refill. The bottomless fries is also a nice touch. Bathrooms were also very clean! I would definitely visit this location again.

My two stars are for the waitress, fries and the bartender. Other than that my burger was tasteless. I ordered the guacamole bacon burger. It literally had maybe a teaspoon of quac spread on the bun. The lettuce was old. No flavor what so ever. The onion ring rack I ordered tasted like the onions we're old and refried. So greasy and tasted like old oil. Very disappointed since I was ready to grub on a "gourmet burger" the fries and service aren't enough to bring me back here again when I'm craving a burger.

The server was nice that's the only reason for one star.  All of our food came out wrong and over cooked.  The table that came in after us received their food ahead of us.  We waited 45 minutes for our food to come out.  After telling the server abOut our complaints,  the manager did not come over.  Second time at a Red Robin,  sadly our last.

Ewww... (Jimmy Fallon Sara voice) worst service ever! Cups had food and sauce on them, a ton of food on the floor, fries were soggy and omg had to wait forever for our food . The manager is trashy and unprofessional! -Never eating at this location again :(
Horrible service. Way too slow and poor attitude by our waitress. 2nd time in a row. I won't be going back.

I will never return to this particular red robin. I love red robin too. Don't come to the Morgan hill location unless you want to wait at least an hr and a half for cold food. It's happened to me 3 times!

OH, MY GOD! JUST NO! My fiancé have come here before and we both love Red Robin. Not this time! We haven't come back in awhile and this was our first time back. It's also going to be out last. Service was slow and crappy! He started off with a margarita for him and a coke for me. It took the bartender more than ten minutes to get it to us. We had a clear view of the bar and saw her gossiping with the other bartenders and texting on her phone! Way to be professional. Good job. We ordered queso and guacamole for an appetizer. The queso came out, but the prep guys never made the guacamole, so it was about thirty minutes before I even got that. The food came out finally after we were wondering if we were going to be able to make our movie. Food wasn't even all that hot. Fries were cold! Waiter came by and asked me if I wanted a refill. I almost told him no because I didn't want to wait, but I said yes. And it took forever before it finally showed. We barely made it to our movie, which started two and a half hours after we went to dinner. I don't recommend this place. To anyone. Unless you have a crapload of patience.

Pretty good ambience, looked clean, and good service. I spilled some water and the waitress actually noticed and even offered to bring out napkins to clean it up. She did clean it up. She also kept asking me when (not if) I wanted more of the bottomless fries (I wound up being too full to accept). Oh, and the Bleu Ribbon Burger was yummy. Definitely sprinkle on a tiny bit of the Red Robin seasoning on the fries and burgers for flavor. The fries don't really stand alone, sadly.

Had a great waitress that is why they got 1 star. The rest was horrible. I had the Chicken Pesto Sandwich, they forgot the Pesto. The waitress brought it at the end of my meal. Great pesto but the moment was gone. Meal was blah. Will not go back.

We usually go to Chili's because of the chips and salsa. I talked my BF into going for a burger at Red Robin. We sat at the bar and a very friendly Mellisa and Travis greeted us. We ordered burger and fries. The restaurant was very busy. Special Olympics event was happening. I gave the restaurant  4stars because our burgers were like warm when we got them. Mellisa quickly took them back and had new burgers made. Travis and Mellisa a 5 star team, can't wait to go back.

i went to this place when it first opened and it was horrible. i went there about a week ago with my son and it was still horrible. im all for co workers chatting but i think some of the staff here forget that the customers can HEAR them.  the only reason i even bothers going back was because i LOVE the red robin in san jose at eastridge, but hate having to drive all the way over there. but id rather drive alllll the way over there then go to this one again
Bergers and fries still good. Only the fried fish and chips are not good. The fish is not completly cooked making the dish teribble. I will return and only stick to the bergers.
got a guac burger on an onion bun...the bun was hard as a rock...and NO guacamole...very disappointing...to their credit, the manager took it off our bill...
Good burgers good choice of drafts beers and to watch college football...love the burger with the egg on it..lol

My husband and I ate lunch at Red Robin and loved it! It is like a hip diner. I had a side salad (size is more like a medum size) that had lettuce, shredded cheddar cheese, tortilla strips and honey mustard poppy seed dressing that was really good. I also had a good sized Santa Fe Burger with ancho, fire-roasted Poblano pepper, guacamole, sauteed onions, crisp tortilla strips, lettuce, Pepper-Jack cheese and Chipotle mayo; dinner fries comes with the burger. My husband had a chocolate malt (like he remembers from small kid time).   He had the Bacon Cheeseburger with three thick slices of hickory-smoked bacon, crisp lettuce, fresh tomatoes, choice of cheese (Cheddar, American, Swiss, Bleu, Provolone or Pepper-Jack or you can split and have two types) & mayo; dinner fries comes with the burger. We will be back to try the Prime Rib Dip, Salmon Burger, Chicken Fajitas, Pasta, Fried Chicken, Fried Shrimp, Soups, Salads and hopefully try their Hot Fudge Sundae, Apple Crisp or Mud Pie! Great menu!

Red Robin has always been a favorite of mine. I've been to many locations and this one doesn't disappoint. I am always seated quickly (even when its busy) and my food comes out exactly how I wanted (and quick, too).
Red Robin has tasty burgers. I love love their garlic fries and onion rings! The service is consistently good from my visits. I will be back

ughh.. need to down star you guys.. so, we got seated quickly... even on memorial day.. our waitress was alright she wasn't really around to take care of us.. i had some empty plates on my tabel.. and when she came around she never took them.. and we had a 2 person booth, so there wasn't much room.. and i had to ask for more water..  i only wished the food made up for it.. i go my usual favorite, chicken tortilla soup. delicious.. but then i went out of my way and tried something new.. new on the menu too.. i ordered the roast beef dip sandwich? something like that.. it wasn't great at all.. the only thing good about it is that garlic fries came with it.. yum!

Red Robins on our road trip.  This place was trendy, upon walking into this establishment, the host was a snobby, blonde woman that kind of gave us a rolled eyes look and sent us to our table.  I ordered the Whiskey BBQ chicken burger which was pretty good because of the perfect temperature that complimented the sauce.  I don't know because of the higher altitude if food tastes better, but I enjoyed my visit here.

Came here for lunch today and got the 5 alarm burger.    Don't you dare call anything "5 alarm" unless it's hot enough to send smoke out of your ears. Bottom line is my 5 year old could have ate this thing without a glass of water. They basically threw some 7-11 style jalapenos on the burger and had some chipotle mayo that was basically mayo with some paprika in it.   They offer this thing called "bottomless steak fries" where you can get as many fries as you want but I have to agree with other reviews saying there was too much salt. Way to much salt even for me.   Got some fancy lime, sprite drink that was so so but 3.99 for that plus the 9.29 for the burger seemed way overpriced for chain restaurant food.   I'm not a big fan of Chili's but this place makes Chili's seem way tolerable.  I won't be back but I had to go check it out since I work down the street.  Staff was friendly and I got seated immediately so that's the star right there.

I will never come back to this location! This place has gone down the tubes. This location has recently under gone a new rule where half of the restaurant is designated for family's and the other half for people all over 21. I thought segregation was already abolished ?!? This is complete utter crap! How am I supposed to enjoy a dinner with my younger siblings when half the restaurant is packed with a 25 min wait and the other side half full? I'd also like to mention since all the families are on one side it is so noisy and this just makes it not appetizing.  Not to mention the service is really crappy since everyone is on one side. I now have to make a 25 minute drive north to enjoy Red Robin in piece and quite!! I suggest a reform in management if this place wants to stay in business. If the segregation rule is placed to try to get under age adults or children to acquire alcohol then that is just blatantly stupid! Have your employees do their job and check everyone's IDs upon drink orders. Sincerely, A pissed off never retuning customer

My Wife and I typically go to the Red Robin in Saratoga, but since we live in South San Jose we thought we'd visit the Morgan Hill location for a change. What a mistake that was. The wait was approximately 20 minutes, that's understandable since it was a Sunday night and everybody's out. However, once we ordered our food, that's where things went bad fast. First of all we clearly told our waiter that we wanted our burgers with the Salsa and Mayo on the side (twice). After waiting about 30 minutes for our food, it comes and sure enough, BOTH orders were wrong. We decided to eat them the way they were, since we'd probably have to wait even longer for them to remake our order. Once our waiter comes back, we ask him for the dressing for my wife's salad. Sure enough, he kept forgetting. Once again we had to wait for the bill to come back, and for a to-go box. I strongly recommend avoiding this place unless you want to just come to hang out with the Red Robin bird walking around with little enthusiasm. Total time including the wait was 1 hour and 45 minutes : (

First, food was as expected.  Stars are for Service.   My daughter was suffering from a migraine and needed to eat. Laura was wonderful! She got her some fry's quickly and worked to get her food out as soon as possible.  By the time we left, my daughter was feeling a bit more like herself and had a handle on her headache.  Kudos to the staff for being so responsive!

My first time here or at any red robin the other day. Let me first say I don't have any clue as to why they have only a 2 1/2 star average but I'll be back to update and if I see some thing I'll update but as far as I can see this place has every thing going for it? The food service and drinks we're all perfect! (by any standards!!!)

I love Red Robin!!  I was introduced to Red Robin when I went to college in Eastern Washington.  Before then, I had never even heard of the restaurant.  I have had numerous things from their menu, and I have enjoyed every one of them.

Ive had mixed experiences here. I got a girl waitress and she was great, and she was super busy so being a server myself I was impressed. Also went back and got a male waiter and he was scattered and not attentive at all. He took our drink order and had to have someone else take our food order. But the food has always been good.
we have ate here many many many times and usually have really good service.  There have been a few occasions where the service has not been so good but those have been rare.

Ok, we tried again. It's not worth it. The kids chicken quesadilla was good, but the fries, overly fried! (our waitress did bring us some to munch on). When we got home I reheated the fries for my DD, the grease that came out of them was disgusting, gross! They have their fryer at too low of a temp, that is why the fries are absorbing the grease. Just not worth the money, time (waitress wasn't that fast) or hassle.

THIS WOULD HAVE BEEN A 2 STAR Review but the manager did his best to make it better and credited us for one of the meals.  we went there with my family and our kids and thought this would be a little bit more kid friendly then most of the other places. but it was just ok. and thats about it. the service was ok but it took way too long for the food to come out and we were served after some the tables that were just seated. to make it worse the  grilled chesse we ordered for my son didnt even come out with our order we had to wait another 10 min for that.  on the Plus side the manager showed concern and like i said did his best to make sure we were taken care of after the fact. the Burgers were awesome and the onion strings were very yummy.  we have been there before and our server Amanda Rocked she was really great friendly and took care of our entire party 10 people as if it were nothing! so maybe better servers?
Just what you would expect from a chain restaurant - good food and nice servers.

I am actually a big fan of Red Robin. My BF & I would truck over to the Eastridge location about once every 2 weeks to meet up with our SJ family & friends. I was so excited when I heard they were opeing here in MH. I thought ...It's about time!!!! I've already been to this location 3x's and it's been both good and bad. The first time we sat at the bar, we had fast service, great burger...... everything was perfect. All though I was a bit unimpressed with the layout. Second time had lunch here and ordered one of my faves  "The Chicken Ensenada Platter" - it was a little on the salty and saucey side. I had to scrape the sauce off the chicken breast. We had dinner here again and had burgers & fries. It was Ok. The wait staff has always been good on all occasions. I'm not sure if I like the restaurant itself (as far as the layout) The food is not as good as the SJ location but I'm hoping that the chef will get it together soon. I'll keep coming here for the burgers, fries & the wings!

Oh man, I feel so sorry for these guys.  The terrible reviews, ugh.  What are they going to do?  Improve? LOL! i am a Red Robin fan, and I wasn't impressed with this location.  The service was pretty slow and the bar area seemed a little cramped.  The Chili's right next store is probably a safer bet if you want some quick, unhealthy food.  ;) I'll try them again in a few months, hopefully they improved.  I'm a sucker for their french fries.

This hamburger restaurant needs to learn how to cook hamburgers. My son ordered his medium well and it was medium rare. I ordered my well down and it was still pink, when I sent it back it came backed burnt, like a charcoal briquet around the edges (perhaps out of spite?). The manager took it off the bill, but I would not eat here again. Service was not great, we got charged for a drink we didn't order and waited long for everything, though it looked like they had a great many employees on duty. It seems to be a badly managed place. The poor waitress was very apologetic.

ive been at this place several times and mostly its ok. this specific time was pretty bad though. the greeter opened the door for a family in front of us, and also my family as well and greeted us like normal. however she seated the family before us and then her and two other greeters stood backs to us at the podium chit chatting for a couple minutes. one turned to us and seated us. it was a bit irritating having her greet us and immediately ignore us as well as not acknowledge her mistake. while we were waiting for our food i saw one waiter doing all the work while several other "workers" just stood in a circle talking. when we got our deserts, we had a brownie ice cream thing and the brownie was rock hard, i had to put quite a bit of effort to cut it.  with the exception of desert, food was good and our waiter was great but everything else there did not meet the expectations i had, compared to my previous visits. i hope this was just a one time thing. i would give this experience 2 stars but most other times have been better so im giving it 3.

Love me some Red Robin - no matter which location! But in terms of the Morgan Hill one - I have never had a bad experience here! Staff is attentive and friendly with kids as well. I actually have only seen the red robin character at this location only - never at any others! Never too busy, the endless fries with the delicious seasoning are the reason I come here! For the seasonal foods - I recommend the gingerbread milkshake -- YUMMMMMYY! The royal burger = my fave, pair it with a root beer float = perfection! No complaints! Go here for great food and nice staff!
What can you expect from a chain? I ordered the steak sliders and the meat was pressed in circle forms which brings back memories the McRib from McDonalds

My 5 year old loves the Pizza and the Red Bird characters.   I go there for the bottomless onion rings, but this place has terrible service and I will not go back.   I know it is not a TOP restaurant and I  would give them a break because we all can have bad days, but I expect better service than Mcdonalds and I blame the management for these characters.    -Mr Personality (the host) after being told how many was  in our party might learn to greet us, let us know how long the wait is, or ask us to follow him rather than focusing on making sure his menus are clean.     -My lost  in thought (waiter) could try serving us, maybe getting drinks,  within 15 minutes after ordering and get have silverware on the table before the food has arrived..  Weird how I made four different request for these things.   The last straw was asking, or reminding, the staff that they did not have any toilet paper in the bathroom.     I have one word for everyone:  CHILIS

I ordered the bacon cheeseburger with a few modifications. Instead of fries I had the Mac & Cheese. They are really great about letting you modify anything you order & my burger was cooked just right. Ambiance is casual, & the price range is not too expensive. Overall, good service & good burgers.

First, if I want a good tasting burger, I'll go to in and out. This service was subpar. Case in point, my order came with fries but I wanted onion rings. I told the waitress that I wanted onion rings instead and she said sure no problem. My order finally came with....fries!!! Ummm, can I have onion rings instead please, the waitress apologized and brought me my onion rings 10 minutes later. I ate one ring and wanted to barf, I waited 10 minutes for this. So I trashed them and ended up eating the better tasting fries. I get my bill and they charged me $.99 extra for the gross onion rings. I called the waitress over and asked her what was the deal. With a matter of fact attitude she said, "yeah, didn't you see the writing on the menu". Oh yea, I'm sorry I forgot my magnifying glass. Red Robin, you've been shot down and being fed to the buzzards. I will never ever eat there!!!

By far the worst customer service! Their hostesses were beyond rude and cared more about the story a waiter was telling rather then seating a customer. Apparently you cant be seated at their bar unless the bartender isn't off break yet a person is standing in the bar making drinks. Everytime I've went into RR the service was horrible I wouldn't recommend at all!! Of course unless you want to leave irritated. The one at Eastridge mall is by far the best.

Food is solid, kind of what you expect.  Waiter service is great, though the front/greeter staff are nowhere near as good.  Too many empty tables while people wait with no explanation.  I enjoy visiting here.

Went there to meet up with family for a great meal.  Truly disappointed from the get go, took 20 minutes to get anyone's attention to seat us.  Then I ordered a burger well done, no cheese and of course got a rare burger with cheese.  At first, I had just asked for steak sauce before I even bit into the burger, that took forever, then I noticed it was not cooked to well done, couldn't find anyone to help out.  I then asked for the manager, she offered another burger, eveyone else had eaten at this point so I said no.  Sad to say, I won't be back, if they can't even cook a hamburger, nor can you find your waiter for help and then the manager comes along at the end of your meal for a replacement burger that just doesn't work.   Truly disappointed in a local place to eat, I'll go elsewhere to catch up with family and friends and a good meal.

This is probably one of the few Red Robin's that I've been to that have good service.  Always busy at lunchtime but you can be in and out is a short timeframe.  Food was good.  Expect to see families here with kids.

So we get there around 6:30 and we're starving, we place our order and ask for a basket of fries to hold the 5 of us over until our meal is served.  My wife had asked 3 times and 2 different people to please bring us the basket of fries, we were continually told they'll be right out. We also had to continually ask our waiter for drink refills.We finally got them when we received the bill.  The food is good but the service SUCKED!!  This place used to be decent for service and food but seems to be lacking in our several recent trips.  Chili's is right across the parking lot guys, figure it out quickly.  Enjoy your $2 tip, we wont be back!
Very good food and service. Great place for burgers, sandwiches and salads. Looks brand new.

Have gone three times and each time the restaurant has been busy but the service was surprisingly good.  Wait times were very reasonable and the servers were pleasant.  I think it's pricey for just burgers, but they are above average burgers from a size and taste perspective.  All-you-can eat fries are kind of pointless since no one I know has room for more fries after eating a big gut bomb burger.
Just okay. Burgers and fries are about the same each time. But service varies wildly. It totally depends on your server whether you get your food hot or in a timely manner.
Great place for a burger, salad or shake!!! I eat here all of the time. Always treated well.

I'm giving these guys two stars not one because I do enjoy the burgers, they're standard chain restaurant fair, whatever. I grew up in Morgan Hill, I didn't live there but I went to high school there and couldn't WAIT to not have to go there everyday to be harrassed. Ok, so that being said, I'm working for my step-dad who's office is in their house IN Morgan Hill. So a week ago our car was in the shop so my boyfriend couldn't come pick me up and he'd had a rough day at school so I thought I'd cheer him up with some Red Robin burgers! Nice, huh? Then I walked in. I felt like I was the outcast in high school all over again. Is it SO hard to have your wait staff greet your customers with a smile? Is it? How about training them to NOT give people dirty looks? So I look a little odd, what of it? Does that make my money not good enough for you? Lucky for us we don't live that far from another Red Robin. I'm not a fan of eating IN their restaurant as it gets too loud and crowded but I won't be coming back to the Morgan Hill location.

I concur with the other two reviews.  I add salt to everything and even I had a hard time with the burgers - at times it seemed as thought the cook straight out dropped the salt shaker in the burger.   I couldn't even allow my kids to eat their fries because they were marinating in salt.  Pretty nasty.  Service was okay.
